Reviews.Title: “Nice, centrally located jumping off point”
Reviews.Author: madonerider
Reviews.Content: My significant other and I just spent a week at the Parkway International Resort. This was a last minute trade of my time share through Interval International. The resort is in a nice location, and, for us anyway, was a good location, located close to Interstate 4 for the things that we did - which didn't include Disney World - although it is very close should that be on someone's agenda. It's a nice trip to Tampa/Clearwater Beach (westbound), and the Kennedy Space Center/Cocoa Beach (eastbound), as well as being close to Celebration, FL. (The Disney planned community - think the Jim Carrey movie "Truman"). Parkway is not a destination resort. That being said, we found that the staff was pretty helpful and mostly very friendly. The condo itself was nice and comfortable, and the unit that we stayed in backed up to the forested area between the Parkway Resort and the Vacation Villages. It was quiet, and the screened in patio allowed us to eat all of our meals outside, watch the birds, squirrels, geckos, snails, and listen to other birds and frogs. The pool was more than adequate, and during our time there, not very crowded. However, the food at the Kenya Kafe -which is at the pool - left a little to be desired (not a great variety and nothing truly healthy), but under the circumstances, it wasn't too bad. The little walkways through the forested areas were very pleasant, and there was a little educational material, and one leads to a strip mall with a few restaurants. The down side: these are really minimal. The fitness room left a lot to be desired. The weight machine is a piece of junk. Clearly the room was created as an after thought, and all of the equipment was stuffed into a very small space. The condo itself could use better lighting. While they were using flourescent lights - this is good - they could still use higher wattage. The low wattage and some of the dark colors left the condo a little dark. The frig (at least in our unit) should have the door reversed (and it can be done - it is built for that change) so that you can get into it without having to step into the laundry room in order to open the door and remove things. The Wi-Fi internet access is expensive. Really this should be free. I am really! The resort could use a good recycling program. Maybe recycling is not that big in Florida, but we had a great deal of recyclable materials from the grocery store, and I don't think that any of it will be recycled. (I hope that I'm wrong - and I admit I didn't ask). This could be simply accomplished management! Would I stay there again? Possibly, depending on what I wanted to do in central Florida. I'd call this a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome 10 Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: karen45
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Thursday, March 22nd and stayed for 10 nights in Nairobi 308. I had called a couple of months ahead of time with 3 requests: a renovated room, a room on the top floor (we were burned a couple of times with kids running in rooms above us at other timeshares), and the type of room where the toilet area was in its own room. We received all three plus we were put in a room where the pool was just out our back door! Maybe because we checked in on a Thursday afternoon we had no one ask us about a timeshare presentation? We did receive a phone message and a notice about it but we ignored both of them with no problems at all. We were very pleased with our unit -- the photos posted by others are exactly what you will have. Thanks to other reviews I brought a small shower caddy as I knew there would not be anywhere to place things in the shower. Everything was in working order and the screened porch was a great place to dry swimwear and pool towels. The only thing I found strange is that there was not a door seperating the master bedroom and the master bathroom so whoever got up first woke up the late sleeper! The location cannot be beat! Very close to Disney, not too far to Universal and TONS of restaurants very near by. There is a Target store a couple of miles away and we took advantage of it several times. We usually do not spend a lot of time at a pool (too busy on rides) but after one trip to the pool at Parkway we were hooked! The water was very refreshing and there were plenty of places to sit by the pool. We did not try the Kenya Kafe but the food looked good. The washer/dryer in the unit was great--for once I did not bring 3 suitcases of dirty laundry home! We would throw towels in and run the washer in the morning before we left for the parks and then threw them in the dryer at night. I love not having to worry about people entering our unit and making our own beds is not a big deal...I mean does it take more than 3 minutes? We did use the oven to reheat some leftover pizza and we used the toaster but other than that there was no cooking done in our unit :) !! We had plenty of space to spread out and the 3 tv's were great (I'm not a big basketball fan and 24/7 ESPN is not my style). The two tv's in the bedrooms are a tad bit older but no big deal. I did not go on vacation to watch tv!! I also appreciated the tile floors throughout the unit (except for the bedrooms) as I feel it is much cleaner. The beds were really comfortable and we slept like logs. Others complained about the noisy airconditioner outside the 2nd bedroom but my daughter likes white noise and this lulled her to sleep every night. My wishes for this condo? A nightstand in the master bedroom please. I made do by bringing a stool from the kitchen counter into the bedroom. A list of "to do's" for checking out -- I had to ask what they wanted us to do. A printer in the room that housed computers would be great too. The front desk people were super nice and let us print our boarding passes there. The area is very nice and not as sketchy as some areas of Kissimmee. Can't wait for more vacation time in Florida and we will definately be back!!

Reviews.Title: “stayed there in Dec of 2010 and LOVED it”
Reviews.Author: heather h
Reviews.Content: this place was awesome..we checked in at night and were so tired from driving all the way from Michigan to Florida and the motel we stayed at the following night was just plain nasty..this place exceeded our expectations..it was a beautiful 2 bedroom with 2 bathrooms with a jetted tub in the master bedroom with a separate shower and a private balcony entrance from our bedroom..the other bedroom had two beds and a pull out couch..only complaint was the pull out couch was not comfortable at all. it was close to the main strip of stores and restaurants and the kitchen is fully stocked so making breakfast there saved us a lot of money. the grounds were beautiful and the scenic trail bridge was playing cool music as you walked..had a pool and a hot tub and a bar..the bar wasn't open though in DEC..we didn't get a chance to swim because it was still a bit cold outside and we were to busy at universal..this is a timeshare and they do ask you to take there tour but we just opted out of it and never felt pressured..the jetted tub was awesome after a long day at the parks.i was pregnant and my feet were killing me and this was the perfect end to the night..the price was great too..this place is a total GEM ..go there and you will NOT be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “been going for 12 years”
Reviews.Author: mary v
Reviews.Content: We are actually owners here and look forward to coming every year. The front desk has always been wonderful. The rooms have always been spotless. The "boardwalk" walking trail has always been a favorite. Not crazy about the timeshare presentations, but that's just Orlando. We usually go to them to get heavy discounts on attraction tickets. It's a couple of hours, but hey- you can always say no. The grounds are beautiful, and the resort is close to EVERYTHING. Great place. Going back for two weeks in June 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Don't show up after dark”
Reviews.Author: coolecg
Reviews.Content: We arrived after dark. There are speed bumps leading up to the resort that are not visible until you ;hit them even though the road is a public roadway. Check in was easy, we were told where our room way. Carried luggage up to the third floor and found the key access would not work because it was the back door. Carried everything back down and around and back up again. There is no markings on the curb and my husband and I both fell off the curb in the dark due to the poor lighting. Rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Timeshare Facility”
Reviews.Author: hoos90
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom that was very spacious. Only complaints would be that the kitchen is not well stocked, and the master bath only had a very tiny sink area, with very little room to put your things other than around the large tub. The resort is in a great location to get places around Orlando. We actually visited Legoland, which is about a 40 minute drive away.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: PittsburghGeese
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at Parkway International and had a wonderful time. We had a two bedroom condo overlooking the pool. Though the property shows some signs of age, it is well maintained and the staff couldn't be friendlier. The pool area was a very pleasant place to spend time and the pool bar was adequate, staffed by two wonderful bartenders.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: howic304
Reviews.Content: The Parkway was nicely tucked away from 192. It was quiet, but still close to everything you would need. Check in was easy and quick. The room itself was quite spacious. The safari decor is a bit dated, but that did not really detract from the experience. We enjoyed eating breakfast on the screened in porch every morning even if there was no view. The kitchen was an added benefit. Beware of guest services. They kept pestering us with free gift offers and the VIP breakfast. It was a timeshare pitch, but you do get paid to be there. If you can waste 3 hours of a day, it might be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Sunworshipper28
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this accomodation twice now and will be there once again at Easter 2012 and have to say this accomodation is superb. From the spacious rooms to the front desk...just wish they would not pass me over to the Time share before giving me the parking pass..but that has never been real hard sell

Reviews.Title: “Never Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: MsBeaton
Reviews.Content: Our family has made visiting parkway in orlando a tradition over the years. Simply put, we are never disappointed in the accomodations, the staff at the front is always friendly and accomodating and enjoy answering any questions. I have since recommended parkway to 2 other families from our home town that I knew where travelling to the kissimmee area and they too were pleasantly surprised with their reservation at parkway. Unlike other reviews we have never experienced any problems with bugs or pests, we have always found the bedding to be comfortable, rooms cleanly, kitchens supplied with adequate utensils, and specific requests adhered to whether it be for more towels or toilet paper, it is always accomodated without incident. Those who complain that this condo complex is not up to par are those who are looking for a 5 star accomodation without paying the 5 star price. Well surprise Parkway is a 3/4 star accomodation and they make no secret of this and they provide exactly this and beyond in my opinion. As far as I am concerned parkway exceeds many 3 stars I have stayed at and the price is always right. Finally parkway international is ideally located to the interstate highway which will direct you to all parks, it is conveniently located near many shopping venues, restaurants, etc. It is a quiet area perfect for families who want to come home after the hustle and bustle of a disney park and just relax. As earlier stated....NEVER DISAPPOINTED with parkway.

Reviews.Title: “week 51 for rent or exchange or for sale, 20 years owner”
Reviews.Author: norman h
Reviews.Content: we have owned there for almost 20 years, 1992 to 2012 and have stayed there 20 times, our family has out grown florida. yes it is 20+ years old, but upgrades and or replacements are done on a timely schedule. I have had no problems at all, I find the staff friendly helpful and courteous, the rooms have always been ready when checking in. If I needed anything, it was dealt with in a timely manner. They even have 24 hour security, they have never had any problems, and that's the way they want it to be, so you can feel safe, like staying at home. I would recommend this resort with no hestitations. I use tripadvisor all the time, and the poor and very poor comments, for most resorts, are usually the people you can't please at all, regardless of how hard you try. There are exceptions to everything, but you treat someone with respect you use get treated the same way. as far as time share tours with any resort, just tell "no thanks" inquires at puzzlecollector2 at yahoo dot ca

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back”
Reviews.Author: DRMacKay
Reviews.Content: We have definitely found the place to stay from now on. My husband and I absolutely loved this place. The price was right and the location of the resort is perfect if you plan to go to Disney, however, it is not close to Universal Studios. We took time to walk to the Starbucks that is open 24 hours, IHop, CVS, Wendy’s and many other stores/restaurants. You could also walk to the Arabian Knights dinner theater. We were so impressed with the huge size of the rooms and the cleanliness. We felt like we were staying in an apartment. We felt so at home and the beds were extremely comfortable. I loved having the large kitchen. The staff and front desk were pleasant and helpful. The theme and décor was fantastic. We felt like we were in an African jungle which was an awesome feel. I can’t say enough good things about our visit to Parkway International. We didn’t have any issues during our stay. My only regret is that we couldn’t stay longer. We will be coming back soon and plan to stay longer. We opted out of the tour/free breakfast offer. My only suggestion is that they consider offering WiFi for free.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Kissimmee's best kept secret!!!”
Reviews.Author: vab300m
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 8 day stay and absolutely loved it. Parkway International Resort is a great place to stay if you want a great price and close to disney attractions, places to eat and other smaller attractions, its right in the heart of things. Its just like a small apartment with a kitchen, 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, washer and dryer, dining area, living room and balcony. We had an issue with the jet tub in the master not holing in the water but a quick call to the front desk and 5 minutes time someone came to fix it. Thanks Parkway International for a great stay, I've found a home away from home!!!

Reviews.Title: “Suggestions for this resort”
Reviews.Author: GinnydMorristown_NJ
Reviews.Content: Parkway International Resort is a great place to stay in the Disney World area, however I know management reads these reviews, so I have a few suggestions. WiFi should be offered free of charge, ($30.00 per week), and local phone calls should be free of charge (.87 per call), The smaller bathroom could use a couple of towel rods to hang towels to dry. Lighting in the small bedroom is very dim and the room is a bit stuffy, so a ceiling fan and light like the one in the master bedroom would be a welcome addition. Live music and Kareoke at the pool were entertaining, Kenya Kafe food could be improved. All the staff were friendly and helpful. Other than that, we agree with all the other positive reviews of this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Unit, Grounds and Location”
Reviews.Author: stb501
Reviews.Content: The Parkway International Resort provides living units with kitchens and bedrooms. The unit has its own washer and dryer. The back of my unit opened up to a wooded area with tennis courts. There were both front and back doors and a screened in patio. The development shares a nature preserve with the next development. There was a jetted tub in the master bathroom. Everything was kept up well. You are close to grocery stores, restaurants, and the quaint town of Celebration. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value stay”
Reviews.Author: karensolihull
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Parkway after reading Trip Advisor reviews and really glad we did. Location is great, we walked to Arabian Nights and it was only a 20 min stroll up to Logans, Joe's Crab shack and Mulligans bar in the Watertower which we really enjoyed. Easy to park and the outside of the building was nice, only thing was that it was a little dark in the evening but we still felt safe and secure - they had security staff too. Check in was really pleasant and they put us in a conda right overlooking the pool in the centre of the resort. We loved the room and could have stayed a lot longer - it was a home from home! 2 lovely bedrooms, both with their own bathroom and a huge kitchen and lounge area. Pool was nice and clean - my only issue was the really loud live music and karaoke on there. We didnt enjoy it but I'm sure other people would do so we kept in the far end of the pool area which was a little quieter Overall it was great value for money and we would definately stay again

Reviews.Title: “Just book it! We couldn't recommend it enough.”
Reviews.Author: Char3238
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our holiday having stayed at the Parkway for the first time and honestly we wish we had found this place sooner. We stayed in the Congo block and had a view over the pool area. The apartment was spacious clean and has all the mod cons including a jacuzzi bath! The pool area was spotless and the hot tub was indeed hot and lovely! The staff were great and you couldn't get much closer to Disney without staying on site. Value for money for sure. Ok so the decor is not to everyone's taste but we will be back without a doubt. Thank you Parkway for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: Chad C
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the resort was great. Everything seems to be newly painted and looks awesome. Our suite was very spacious and just above the pool. We did get the timeshare sales pitch but it was avoidable. We chose to do it because there was a free meal and cheap tickets to Arabian Nights available. A couple of hours of goofing off trying to make the salesman feel awkward was totally worth the payoff. Beyond that experience, our time here was great. No bugs as others have mentioned. The beds weren't the most comfortable but then again, any bed that isn't YOUR bed never lives up. We would DEFINITELY stay again. Great Value! Friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, sylvan setting away from the Disney World bustle.”
Reviews.Author: Mom3girls
Reviews.Content: The only negatives I have about the place are 1, the wifi isn’t free (but it is only $30/week for up to 3 laptops); 2, accessibility - there’s no elevator, very few handicap parking and curb cuts; Idk if there are accessible rooms; I can tell you that having the two scooters in the room all week was a little cumbersome; I assumed that with only the 2 of us, we’d be able to keep the scooters in the 2nd bedroom, but neither of us were able to maneuver them into that room – the awkward placement of the 2nd bathroom prevented that -- so I’m not sure how a wheelchair would fare); and 3, that there’s only one phone in the entire unit. There also were no grab bars around the tubs/showers, and I had to request a rubber tub mat because their floors are slippery. Those are minor, though. The positives are everything else! The resort is next to the Arabian Nights dinner show, and well set-back from Rte. 192/Irlo Bronson Memorial Highway, and easy to get to and from DW, I-4, I-Drive, etc. It’s a short drive to area attractions; and the resort itself is beautiful, serene and quiet with pretty and consistent themeing throughout, and ALL the units are 2-bedrooms and 2-bathrooms. The suite itself: If you can, imagine the general layout as two large rectangles side-by-side – the bedrooms/bathrooms/lanai to the left, the living room/ kitchen/ laundry on the right. You enter into a small foyer/corridor; to your left is the smaller bedroom and bathroom; to your right is a small coat closet. You walk into the short corridor a few feet; the kitchen and laundry nook on your right, l/r in front of you, and master bedroom/bath to your left. The smaller bedroom contains two single (twin) beds with a storage nightstand between them, with a lamp; also a t.v./storage armoire and a closet. The 2nd bathroom is split. First you come to the mirrored vanity/sink with storage cabinets/drawers beneath; to the left of that (behind the smaller bedroom) is the smaller room with the commode and shower/tub, with a small nook with a few built-in shelves. The master bedroom contains a K bed with 2 storage-nightstands, and a t.v. and storage armoire. The master bathroom contains a whirlpool tub, commode, separate stall shower w/ a door, and a large mirrored vanity/sink with storage cabinets and drawers below. The beds were heavenly. We do not like soft mattresses, and these were just a little softer than what we have at home, very comfortable for both of us. I’m not thrilled with the soft pillows, but I’ve come to expect them at hotels so I just deal with them. Tip: I’ve learned that we like dark rooms, and that most hotel drapes do not close completely, so I’ve learned to pack a few binder-clips to solve this problem. A bonus is that the clips can also be used as snack-bag clips ;). To the right is the fully-equipped kitchen: full-size fridge with ice-maker, smooth cooktop/electric oven, m/w, d/w, toaster, blender, double-sink with sprayer, and fire extinguisher (you never know …). Basic cooking needs: set of pots/pans and cooking utensils, glass measurer and measuring spoons, corkscrew, ice bucket, can opener, cutting board, and a set of knives in a block. Also there were 3 oven-proof and m/w-able glass baking pans, two rectangular and one round with a lid, dishes and lots of glassware for dining, as well as dining utensils, a 2-qt. pitcher and four placemats. The phone is also in the kitchen. There is a breakfast counter with two stools, plus a large dining table with four chairs. (There are also several artificial floral arrangements in the suite, and a statue of a tiger on top of the l/r entertainment armoire!) In the back of the kitchen (which would also be behind the entry door) is the laundry nook which contains a stacked washer and dryer. As with other timeshares, you get a starter-pack when you check-in (several rolls of bathroom tissue, facial tissues, hand soap, bath, hand towels and washcloths; a kitchen towel and dishcloth, 2 potholders, a sponge, dish detergent for hand-washing dishes, 2 packs of d/w detergent, a roll of paper towels, 2 packets of laundry detergent, and 6 pool towels. If you need more of anything, you just call the front desk and they send it right over. I requested a rubber tub-mat around 9:30 the first night and it arrived within 20 minutes. (I’m assuming this is a positive indication of the level of service; we had no other service needs other than internet issues, which are handled by an outside company.) They also give you an option for fresh towels. You can launder them in your suite as needed, and/or you can opt for a towel exchange mid-week. If you choose the towel exchange, you can further opt to have your towels exchanged at their convenience (meaning they may need to enter your suite while you are out) or at your own! If you forget to fill out this form (which is in your suite at check-in), you are on your own for towel issues lol. We opted to wash our own, in their washer/dryer, using their detergent and hot water too, not too difficult a chore. In the l/r are a queen-sized sofa (that can be opened up for another bed), an easy chair and ottoman, two end tables and a coffee table, and an entertainment armoire that contains a flat-screen TV. and a DVD player (movies can be rented from the office but at $6-something, I’d skip them); there is loads of storage in this piece, and on each side of this piece of furniture are end-table type ledges as well. At the far end of the L/R is the exit door to the rear; there is a small patio-type space right outside the doors, and there are board walkways throughout the rear of the resort; leading to the office, the pool, other buildings, and there is a nature trail as well! To your left is a door leading to a screened lanai (on the 2nd floor, this would be a balcony) with a patio set (table and four chairs). Dh loved this space. He used it to set up our Halloween decorations – a ginormous inflatable Mickey-Pumpkin, two strings of lighted (small) Mickey-pumpkins, a Disney garland, and small lighted Mickey-ghost and Mickey-pumpkin statuettes. People passing by loved it, especially kids lol. Other notes re. the rooms: if you request a unit in buildings A, B, or D, you’ll be less than a half-block walk to the pool. Also, the theme is “rustic resort” and like Disney’s Fort Wilderness Lodge and Animal Kingdom Lodge buildings, with their (appropriate) darker colored motifs and surrounding lush foliage, makes for more dimly-lit rooms. The suite, and in fact the entire resort as well, were clean throughout, and very well kept/maintained. We did visit the pool one afternoon, but it wasn’t quite warm enough to stay in long; we then moved over to the hot tub which was better! Tip: by 3:00 p.m., the pool becomes mostly shaded, so you may feel chilly when exiting the water (depending on when you visit, of course). We came here on an Interval International Getaway (timeshare exchange company), but even if we’d exchanged, I think this is an excellent resort and a great value; I would not hesitate to stay here again. BTW, if you’re going to stay at timeshare resorts, you have to realize that they do not offer daily maid service (some provide it for an extra fee); also you will be solicited to attend a presentation to invite your ownership in the resort you are staying at. However they usually offer you some kind of remuneration for your time – a gift card, show or park tickets, a meal, discounts, or even cold hard cash. If you do not want to participate in this, you simply just tell the solicitor such when approached. Timeshare solicitors also have kiosks throughout the Orlando and Kissimmee areas, at restaurants, malls, etc. I didn't post any pictures of my own because the pictures on the resort's website are better and more importantly, are an accurate depiction of the resort itself.

Reviews.Title: “Loved staying at Parkway International!”
Reviews.Author: lisale
Reviews.Content: We stayed 11 nights at the Parkway International in early October. It was a really nice timeshare condo, complete with kitchen and stack washer/dryer. Spacious living room, very comfortable beds (king size in the master bedroom, 2 twins in the 2nd bedroom), jacuzzi tub (wow!) in master bath, clean carpets, nicely kept grounds. Staff at check-in were very nice. Ample parking. Lighting in the parking lots at night could be brighter, but it wasn't bad. Great location - very close to the highway onramps, very close to the roads that take you to all the Disney parks. Lots of restaurants and gift shops along Irlo Bronson. Sea World and Universal Studios parks were very close. Busch Gardens Tampa was about an hour drive away (worth the trip!). We loved everything about the Parkway and would gladly stay there again! We were informed of timeshare presentation meetings, but there was no pressure to attend them. Also, if you want maid service, you just schedule it with the front desk. They charge a fee for it (about $30?). Otherwise, this place is just like home, but nicer!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: CKNJ
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 6 day stay with my family. Absoulety loved it!. We were in the Serengeti building, across from pool/check in area. The room was clean and smelled wonderful. It was very spacious, and we loved the backdoor area, and screened in back porch. The only negative we could find was that the master bed was a bit hard for our liking, but we dealt with it. We had a tripped outlet for the hairdryer one morning and maitenence came out within 3 mins to fix it! The pool area is awesome. Not too big, and not too small. It wasnt crowded at all, and there was plenty of chairs to go around. My daughter loved the playground area as well! They did not hassle us about timeshare at all (we inquired and we found out later they didnt have any units available). We will booking next years vacation with them as well!! Very happy with everything!! oh and i didnt see any cockroaches :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Handymanwife
Reviews.Content: Our family of 7 (5 adults, 1 teenager and 1 three year old) just got back from a week in Orlando. We stayed at Parkway Int'l and enjoyed it very much. We found the rooms clean and very pretty. The pool area and grounds around the resort were exceptional. The staff was very helpfull whenever we needed anything. The resort is also within a few minutes of the theme parks. There are three floors but no elevators. We were on the 2nd floor and did not find it to be a problem at all. We will definitely be coming back to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: rmilagros
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our 7-day stay at Parkway International. I must say that we were a little concerned due to some of the reviews that we read prior to arriving. However, I must say we were very pleased with our room, service and customer service (with the execption of one person). Our check-in was great and so was our check out. No roaches (one Palmetto Bug in the living room; make sure to not keep your door open for long periods of time), DB got rid of it and that was the end of it. We did have tons of "love bugs", but they are in season right now all over Florida. Rooms were spacious, clean, and we were very happy. Our first night there we hung out at Kenya Cafe, go hang out with Greg & Norm, these guys will hook you up with some serious drinks and maybe even surprise you with some special dishes, just go early since they close around 9 (my only complaint is that they closed early and the pool is open til 11). Parkway is in a great location, close to all theme parks, highways, parkways and even restaurants. Pool was nice! Give a it a chance and keep those doors closed.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings about resort, but stay was ok, wont be back.....”
Reviews.Author: deelovesdis
Reviews.Content: I just spent a week at the Parkway International.. Checking out Sept 2nd. The resort which is really just a few buildings and one pool, oh, yeah, and a tennis court was pretty empty and despite my requests to be near the pool ( I am handicapped and cannot walk more than 100 feet without assistance,) I was put in building G. The pool is behind building A. The front desk said" its just a walk around the buildings, not to bad of a walk". I said I cannot walk that far. 500 yards or whatever, anthing more than 100 feet , its all too hard for me. I understand it is hard for people to realize that a chubby healthy looking woman who seems to have no disabilities - has a disability. I have COPD, and several herniated discs which make it extremely painful to walk more than a few steps at a time. Of course I understand requesting a room near a pool is only a request, but most hotels try to be accomodating. I was told a note was put in the computer to try to get me a room closer. From what I understand , the male at front desk didnt put a note in or try to get me a closer room. I made a few calls to the front desk, each time getting someone else, assuring me they would try to move me. Getting in my car and driving to the pool was a joke! You are soaking wet and make your seats in your car wet and then they smell up the car like mildew!! Finally on Tuesday I was moved to a room closer! IT was great, ground floor room right near the pool! I could walk out the back dooor to the pool and see my child from the patio. So , now I start seeing giant COCKROACHES! No, not the florida Palmetto bugs, these were cockroaches! Could I ask to be moved again? No. So now my dream room has roaches. Not a dream anymore. I was so concerned with my luggage and clothes and of bringing them home with me. I had to sort through all my luggage and wash and dry everything, it took me hours. I did inform the front desk about the roach problem and they did use the eco friendly company. I also did tell them about the front door. seems the bottom of the door was too high and we actually saw a roach come in under the front door. So, we were in the room far from the pool for 4 days, and couldnt utilize the pool, now in a room that had cockroaches, which really turned me off, and ruined my time. I am still hoping one of the roaches didnt hide in one of our suitcases and come home with us. We drove so they could have made the trip back here alive. THe room was nice. Actually the building G room was very nice with a huge bathroom. Building A room was a little smaller,the bath room was also smaller, with a shower that could only fit a child. Everything was nice enough. Nice kitchen, nice sized beds.but........ We stayed here a few years ago, and lke the other reviewer expected the buildings to be run down-and they weren't. Last time we had a great time , I had a great feeling being here and couldnt wait to come back. THe roaches really upset me and to be honest wont ever come back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Would stay here again tomorrow!”
Reviews.Author: luvlyluvvie
Reviews.Content: We have just returned after a 3 week stay here at the Parkway International and I can honestly say I haven't got a single complaint. Even before we arrived, being paranoid, I emailed the resort to check on our booking and received a friendly and prompt response. We arrived very late after flight delays, but had no problems checking in, the security officer who showed us to our apartment was friendly and courteous and the check in process was quick and easy and at no point were we hassled to buy a timeshare, although if I could have afforded one I would definitely have considered it. The apartment itself was lovely - more spacious and pleasant than our home in England! All the rooms are nicely furnished, the beds are very comfortable and there is certainly every appliance and utensil that I would care to use and plenty that I didn't get around to using! I was especially delighted with the washer/dryer as I don't have a dryer at home and I found it extremely convenient and effective at getting my family's clothes dry quickly. We were in a ground floor condo so we didn't have to climb any stairs and we barely heard any noise from upstairs or next door. If I was being picky my only negative would be that we didn't have a particularly exciting view - over the tennis court and the back of the shops - maybe next time I would see if I could request a condo overlooking the pool, but really that is an extremely small thing. We did see one cockroach in our room - it was no big deal, I trapped it in a glass and put it out the door and were't bothered by any again. The complex itself is small but perfectly formed! Our kids (aged 12, 7 and 5) enjoyed the play area and loved the pool which was heated and lovely to swim in at the end of a long day at the parks. The jacuzzi was amazingly hot and relaxing. Although the pool is quite small, it was never crowded and there was always spare chairs and plenty of room in the water. The nature trail was short, but pretty although I was disappointed we saw no snakes! We did see fish and turtles and lots and lots of lizards and squirrels. Some of the boardwalk was being replaced during our stay but it caused us no problems. We found the staff friendly and pleasant whenever we encountered them. The security guards were often seen doing their rounds (even during torrential rain!) and always said hello. The staff in reception were pleasant, efficient and helpful when we went to collect our suitcases (which had missed our flight), when they sorted out a problem with our room key and on checking out. As for location, the Parkway is in a great place for visiting the Disney Parks, just 10 to 15 minutes depending on which park you're trying to get to and about 20 to 25 mins up to Seaworld and Universal. You are right next to the I4 and a short drive to International Drive. Being located on the 192 there is no shortage of places to shop and eat. You can walk to a few shops and restaurants next door to the complex although I wouldn't advise using the supermarket there as their prices are phenomenal - head up to Walmart on Vineland Road or Turkey Lake Road instead and stock up (they're open 24 hours - we went at 2am!) It is also quite close to Old Town which is worth a trip on a Friday or Saturday night to see the cars. I would recommend an evening visit to Pirate Cove mini golf - there is one just off the 192 or one at Lake Buena Vista (not Pirate Island which is next door to the Golden Corral) - it is very atmospheric and a lot of fun. There are lots of cheap restaurants nearby - I wouldn't recommend Ponderosa, but I have no complaints with Sizzler and the range at the Golden Corral is well worth the price you pay. However, if you want to eat in, there are all the cooking facilities you need in the condo. If I had eaten in more often, I might not have had so much dieting to do now I'm home! All in all, we had an excellent time and I would stay here again tomorrow. Next time we visit Orlando, this would definitely be one of my first choices. Real value for money and we were very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay was great too!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgemTexas
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed here in July 2011, our second time. And, once again, we are quite pleased. The condo is spacious and comfortable. We parents like having our own room. The pool area is nice, but not memorable. The best point, without a doubt, is proximity to the Disney parks. You can get from the condo parking lot to a Disney parking lot in 5-10 minutes. You only go through one light, and even that is a right turn. All this, combined with an awesome rate if $90 a night, made us very happy.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Spring Training Bargain”
Reviews.Author: HooksFan
Reviews.Content: Our family absolutely enjoyed our stay here. We happened to be at this resort the same time that cju13 was there. We were advised on the remodeling going on and adjusted our plans accordingly. Since we weren't there much during the day it really didn't inconvenience us. Our two bedroom/two bath unit was more than spacious for our family of four. Having a kitchen along washer/dryer in the unit cut down on meal and laundry expenses. The location of this resort puts you within short driving distances of Walt Disney World and the Atlanta Braves and Houston Astros Spring Training complexes. As others have pointed out this is a timeshare...they asked me when we checked in if I was interested which I replied I wasn't and that was the end of it. I had to make a minor change to our reservation and the staff was more than accomodating. This was definitely a bargain for the price which we paid. We had no problems with any type of insects and the internet speed was more than adequate. In a couple of years we will probably be interested in a timeshare to coincide with our vacations. Our family will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Still Great!!”
Reviews.Author: lp6145
Reviews.Content: After the initial time share try, everything was great. We stayed here in 2009 and the resort was nice and clean, well kept up and on the smaller side, coming back in 2011 I expected it to be alittle run down, but was surprised to see that it was as nice as before and improvements had been made. Would recommend this resort to anyone. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great find, really good Hotel for the price paid”
Reviews.Author: piggywiggy01
Reviews.Content: After searching for somewhere to stay for 3 nights in Kissimmee and reading the positive reviews on Trip Advisor, I booked the Parkway Int Resort. We found it a bit tricky to find even using Sat Nav, but we had just travelled from the UK so it was in our time the early hours of the morning. However, we had no problems after that. Check in was done very efficiently and the Receptionist was polite and courteous. We stayed in the block opposite Reception, think it was Kilimanjaro. Anyhow we were pleasantly surprised when we stepped into the Condo. The rooms were large and clean and tidy. My daughter slept on the pull out couch which she found comfortable and so were the beds. The kitchenette area was well thought out and appeared to have everything needed for a self catering holiday should you chose to do so. We did however, have problems with both toilets, which had obviously been blocked by previous guests which meant a very early morning on our first day when the bathroom flooded when we flushed the toilet. However, a frantic call to Reception and 10 minutes later the caretaker arrived to sort it out, closely followed by the cleaner. After that we had no problems at all. We were not in Kissimmee long enough to use the facilities at the Hotel but we checked out the pool which looked good. The Hotel is extremely well situated for Sea World and the Magic Kingdom the two parks we visited. Roughly taking around 10-15 minutes to reach them. We also visited City Walks which took about 20 minutes to reach. We would certainly have no hesitation in recommending the Hotel and would certainly use again if we stay in Kissimmee for future Florida holidays.

Reviews.Title: “"Loved it"”
Reviews.Author: smitty2094
Reviews.Content: I had a great time there. The only complaint I do have is that the pool should be cleaned more often since I spent most of my time there. The staff was polite & courteous and the gounds well kept. The activities supervisor, Becky, was smart, funny , and great to be around. I look forward to next year.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful.... would reccommend !”
Reviews.Author: emelainegiles
Reviews.Content: I really do not understand the bad feed back this hotel has recieved. The staff were very welcoming and the 2 bed condo we stayed in was clean and well maintained. The location of this hotel is spot on. You are only minutes away from disney and you are right on the 192 which makes getting anywhere easy. The pool is small but the hotel isn't massive so no need for a huge pool. My children loved it. I canont fault this hotel at all and for the money we paid it was a real bargin. I can say if we ever go back to Kissimmee we will be staying at the Parkway again.

Reviews.Title: “WORST RESORT WE'VE EXCHANGED TO!”
Reviews.Author: Eur0pe06
Reviews.Content: RUN AWAY FROM THIS RESORT - WORST EXPERIENCE EVER!!! We have owned timeshares for almost 15 years. We exchanged our Westin 2BR timeshare via Interval and selected Parkway based on the "premier" designation given by II. We also read the reviews which were, for the most part positive. What an inequitable trade this turned out to be. The unit was a 2 BR, 2BA - it was definitely sized well enough based on sf to accommodate our family of four. And the kitchen was well-stocked with tools, and the AC worked well but as someone else pointed out, it was right next to the second BR and very loud. We had to turn it off at night. The man who checked us in was pleasant enough. The maintenance guy who came to unlock our safe and bring us working knives was timely and helpful. But that is where the positives end. Our unit - B306 - was lacking in the cleanliness department. While dustbunnies and cobwebs are generally excusable, the following are not: used bandaids on the floor, cockroaches in the bathroom and bugs in the utensil drawers. We told the front desk about the bandaids and the cockroach on our 2nd full day. She then proceeded to tell us that she can have the room sprayed but cannot guarantee the odor. My daughter and I have breathing issues and a room full of bug spray is not what I have in mind during my vacation. She promised to get the room cleaned. They changed the towels - but cleaned it was not. More cockroaches showed up again on Friday - this time we brought them the "dead specimen" in a ziploc bag as well as a picture to prove that there is an issue as the first encounter did not seem to generate a serious enough response. I asked for the manager on duty the second time, who proceeded to tell me that they use a eco-friendly service (we weren't told about this the first time and the front desk should have advised their managers of the issue the first time) and she will get them out right away. Should we have left or asked for a different room? Perhaps we should have after the first time but I trusted that they would take care of the problem the first time. After the second encounter - we only had 1 full day left and repacking and moving would have taken too much precious time. The Master Bath was an afterthought. Sure it had a jacuzzi tub - which I guess is a must for all the MBRs nowadays, but they forgot the shower, so a pre-fab shower unit was installed at the corner - no room to bend if you drop anything. A more comfortable shower would have been more useful than the giant 2 person tub. There was one sink, but no countertop and nowhere to hang our toiletries - we had to use the tub wall to store our toiletries. The Master bath was very dark - either they need to change the lightbulbs or add more, but it was dark. There were more switches than there were light fixtures. The second bath was more usable than the Master. The pool area needs updating. After the cleaning issues with our unit, we were quite uncomfortable trying out the pool and the hot tub. When I told the front desk we were in the process of checking out and I wanted to get a receipt to make sure we were not charged for anything, she gave me a rather funny look when I wouldn't give her my room key and explained we were still packing. She proceeded to tell me in a rather snobbish manner that I was not checked out until I turned in my room key. Seriously??? I know there are others that raved about this place. I WILL NEVER GO BACK.

Reviews.Title: “We love it so much we keep coming back year after year”
Reviews.Author: nannybeth3009
Reviews.Content: Discovered Parkway about 8/9 years ago having been moved from sister resort Orbit one where I own after a hurricane, and haven't looked back. Prefer smaller friendly resorts and this fits the bil perfectly, every appartment isn't far from the pool. As previously stated its clean, spacious, close to amenities and maingate. Jackie I loved a previous review calling Becky 'Entertainments Director'. We have made such good friends because of the intimacy of the pool and look forward to catching up with them again this year.My grandchildren and I enjoy the free breakfast but I like that we don't get the free breakfast at the weekend it gives us an excuse to go out. All the staff both Becky's. Norman, Kenny,Jackie are all wonderful and I can't wait to get back in September. Beth, Hertford UK

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT place”
Reviews.Author: brewerfan2
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze, room was a . 2 BR 2 bath , full kitchen and a 6 seat dining room table with another 2 seat table in the living room. Washer, dryer and an inscreened patio, for 105/night tax included. The room is not old and worn like alot of other resorts in Orlando. There is no daily house-keeping and no new towels are brought to the room, unless you pay a fee for them. To me this is no big deal, as I can wash and dry my own. There is daily garbage pick-up as you just leave it right outside your room. The location is excellent. You are just a 10 min. drive to Disney parks, Univ, and Sea World. It is a tad off of 192 but away so there is no traffic noise. There is a grocery store within a 2 minute walk, and scores of trinket stores and restaurants off of 192. The beds were excellent as was the water pressure.With 4 adults in the room, we never lost hot water.The staff that we dealt with were all excellent individuals and very helpful. I was never once approached about buying a vacation home.

Reviews.Title: “Far exceeded our expectations!!!”
Reviews.Author: markstlou
Reviews.Content: Talk about a value! Super clean and spacious! Everything there you would need. Nice pool and hottub, cute nature trail. Only a couple miles from Disney and on one of the "main drags" that allow for quick access to many restaurants and activities! Don't miss this if you can help it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean resort and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: JRF07
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 year old and I stayed here for a week in June 2011. Very convenient location, right around the corner from Disney. Our 2-bed, 2-bath unit was overall immaculate and quiet. The master bedroom's sheets had some hair on it, but the response from the hotel was immediate. We called the front desk and someone was there within 5 minutes to change the room over. We were very impressed with the responsiveness. Nice pool area, playground---very family-friendly. One downside for us was that smoking was allowed in the pool area. Since the pool isn't enormous, I didn't like that we had to be around it. The other disadvantage was there is not free wifi internet----it is $8/day or $30/week, which seemed unnecessarily steep.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again but none of my request were taken care of!”
Reviews.Author: TrueDiva2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed at a the sister company Liki Tiki Resort in 2010 and loved it. Since we had additional people coming with us we were looking for something a little cheaper and Parkway International Resort was perfect. The resort is in a better location than Liki Tiki. It also does not have the water park that Liki Tiki has. Honestly the thing they call a water park is a slide and water fall located in a pool. When I booked my room I requested a poolside and/or first floor room. Needless to say I didn't get either of my request. The lady at guest services advised me that I could stay in the room provided for one night and then she could get me in another room the next day. That didn't work for me so I just stayed in the room provided for me in the Kilamanjaro building 2nd floor room. The Kilamanjaro Building is located across the parking lot from the pool. It takes about 3 mins to get to the pool area so everything turned out ok. My favorite thing about the resort is the pool area. The resort is very small so the pool was never overcrowded and I could always swim without worrying that I was going to bump into someone. I spent several days at the area and my 3 year old son enjoyed it very much. There is a nice park right beside the kiddie pool. My son went back and forth with ease and I was able to see him at all times. Plus the area is gated! The bar/grill is also located beside the kiddie pool. You don't have to worry about bringing any money to the pool because they will charge it to the room. We loved the chicken nuggets in fish batter, nachos and all the spirits. The pool closed at 11 which is very late for most hotels/resorts. The bar only stayed open to around 6 though...I'm assuming this changes in the summer time. There is also a small game room in this area too. There were activities for kids and adults in the area. They played bingo and black jack for money and there were a lot of kiddie activities that my child was too young for. To top off the area they played island music and even had a performer at times. On top of the beautiful pool area the rooms did not disappoint. The living room had a pull out sofa and if you pushed the tables against the wall, there is enough space to add 2 queen size blow up mattresses (one on each side of the pull out couch). There was a nice screened patio with ceiling fan and had a view of a parking lot and trees. We saw 3 raccoons looking for food while we were out on the patio. There was also a grill that was easily accessible by the extra set of stairs for the back of the building. The master room had a king size bed and a patio door for immediate access to the patio. We had new mattresses too...of course I checked. The bathroom had a jetted pool and an additional area for toilet. This was very helpful because someone would go to the bathroom and shut the door and not hold up other people from brushing their teeth etc. I did clean the bathroom but I always do at hotels. The jetted pool had sand in the jets. It took me 15 mins to clean the tub. I believe the people before us went to the beach and the cleaning lady didn't notice the additional sand. The 2nd bedroom was smaller and had an outdated TV but who cares. The twin beds had wheels on them so it was very easy to push them together to make a full size bed. The 2nd room had the water heater in the closet so the room was warm even when the rest of the hotel was freezing. The 2nd bath was ok but I didn't used it. There were no complaints from any members in my party about the 2nd bathroom. I did not see any bugs but my sister explained that she saw an unidentified spider with fur in the room. She killed it and she didn't see any thing else. Kitchen had everything you would need but a small frying pan for eggs. We brought dish washer and laundry detergent and didn't use it. The only thing that they didn't provide was hand soap...so I will be sure to bring it next year. We used the dish detergent that they provided. Washer and dryer are small but served it purpose. We did not use the oven so no comment there. The free breakfast/time share speech is ok if you want to get the 20 dollars off your multiple day passes to the park. They also offer you $100 gift card if you do not want the discount on the ticket. Why not get the money before you leave? If you tell them no they do leave you alone though. Another thing I like about this resort is the home feeling. Once you get there you can have guest over and they have no problem parking. I asked for the 1 hour extension for checkout and it was horrible. The maid bothered me the entire extra hour knocking on the door trying to figure out if I had left yet. She said nobody told her. I guess they need a better system. Overall this resort is just a little bit above average. If you are looking for a comfortable place to stay with privacy in your own room and the option to cook and wash clothes...stay here! Also the exercise room is a joke. They don't have a stair climber...my favorite. They do have a treadmill and elliptical though. The nature trail is a very small path and not even half a mile lol I hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Vacation Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: jaymvita
Reviews.Content: This past April 2011, I booked several days with the Parkway through an exchange company for myself, my wife and our three daughters, aged 6,3 and 1. Upon arriving at the hotel from New Jersey at about 8:00pm in the evening, I was told by Sandra, the desk attendant, that they had no record of me or my reservation in the system. After insisting that I had a confirmation via email, I was allowed to pull up the email and prove that they did indeed have me confirmed. Sandra then proceeded to tell me that the entire resort was booked solid and that they simply had no room for me or my family. Sandra called around to sister resorts to see if they could accommodate us but they had nothing either. At this point, after a half hour of looking to see what happened, the only sure thing was that my kids were without a place to stay in Florida. Luckily, we had friends staying at the resort who offered to put us up for the night until the Parkway could sort out the mess that they had left us in. Unfortunately, they were themselves a family of four which meant that they had to rearrange their vacation plans for one night to squeeze my family of five into their two bedroom unit. Not exactly the heigh of comfort for everyone involved. The next day, the Parkway did find a room for us which was frankly enough given that we had nothing else. The room was fine except for the AC unit which sounded like a jet engine every time it went off. Unfortunately it was located right next to the kids' room which meant that it startled them every time it kicked in. The manager, Vicki tried to ease my anger and disappointment by offering me some complimentary vouchers for future stays, but in keeping with it's record of failing my family, those vouchers have yet to surface. It has been a month since we stayed there. And it will most likely be the very last time we ever visit the Parkway again.

Reviews.Title: “This was our second trip to Parkway and we still love it.”
Reviews.Author: OntarioHopper
Reviews.Content: While the decor is a bit dated, it continues to be clean and great value for the money. We love the location as it is walking distance to restaurants and shopping plus 5 minutes to Disney and 15 to Seaworld. The pool is fantastic and they try really hard to put on activities for the younger kids. We were located on the 2nd floor facing the pool and other than some noise neighbors the first night which a quick call to Security fixed promptly, it was relaxing and easy. You do see Security wandering around so if provided a very safe feeling. There is nothing fancy about Parkway but they are doing upgrades and at 80$ per night, it could not be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: halvi1
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Parkway during a trip to Disney World. We found the room spacious, clean, nicely decorated, and convenient to the pool area. The beds were comfortable, with good quality sheets. The location was convenient to Disney World (less than 10 minute drive to the parking lots). The front desk staff member was friendly and helpful, and she allowed us to check in early since we arrived well before check in time. The person who provides the parking pass will "invite" you to a free 5-star breakfast or lunch, which is really a timeshare presentation in which someone sits with you while you eat, and talks to you about the offer - unless you're really interested or find it worth the discounted tickets or gift card, I would skip this, as it takes several hours of your valuable vacation time. But the resort was great and I would definately recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money, we would return!”
Reviews.Author: holidaymaker3952
Reviews.Content: We have today returned from a 6 night stay at this hotel and would honestly be happy to recommend it. We believe it was great value for money. After reading some of these reviews, I was on constant lookout for any bugs and honestly did not see any in our room and only saw lizards outside! Our apartment was comfortable, all equipment was working and was decorated well. The sofa, however, did appear to need replacing but this appeared out of place as it seemed to be the only item in need of replacement. The air con unit outside bedroom 2 was fairly loud but this did not cause us any problems. The location is great for Disney and also convenient for other attractions. It is not a large resort and therefore does not have a wide range of facilities but the facilities it did have, seemed perfectly adequate. The staff were friendly and although there is currently a lot of painting/refurbishing going on, the workers were accommodating and we were given warning to use the back door to the apartment rather than the front as the front stairwell was being painted. The view from the apartment wasn't amazing, but wasn't unpleasant. As a sister resort, guests of Parkway International are permitted to use the water park of Liki Tiki Village. You are however required to pay for a parking pass which is $5. The Liki Tiki water park is very small (a pool and a few small slides) and although it served a purpose as part of a relaxing 1st day, we would not make the effort to go again. We also made use of the hotel Wifi access and were pleasantly surprised to find that this worked in our room, but we're not sure if it would work in every room. We paid $29.99 for 7 day access, which was worth it for what we needed it for. I believe there was a daily fee option of around $7.99 / day. Overall, we would definitely recommend this hotel due to the value for money.

Reviews.Title: “It's really not bad at all...”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl34352
Reviews.Content: I really worried after reading the other reviews. This is an older resort, but it isn't as bad as people make it out to be. Our unit was clean, although there was a bit of smoke smell lingering in the unit. Everything worked fine. The staff was helpful and friendly. The decor is animal themed, but it really isn't bad at all. The tv's in the bedroom are an older style, but who cares...it's vacation. Who watches TV on vacation? The tv in the family area is a flat screen. The pool was clean and well kept. The poolside bar is "ok". We have stayed in much better, and I have seen much worse. The appliances are updated, and the new building paint looks nice. My only wish would be that there were more amenities, however, the kids club seemed to have really good daily activities. There are two small playgrounds. No bells and whistles, but it really is a nice place to stay.... I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OMG don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: Judytraveler13
Reviews.Content: We traded in our Aruba Surf Club timeshare through Interval International for this timeshare and were we very disappointed! I checked the first unit they gave us and found dead bugs in it...so they gave us another unit....no bugs at first, but we saw them once we got our luggage in. The main problem with these old units is that they are very dark with old furniture and bathroom/kitchen facilities. The couch was very uncomfortable and we were sitting on the edge because the cushions were worn out. There were no elevators and we needed a bottom floor for my mother. They were painting the outside with a rust color and overspray was all over the doors and stairs. The plants outside were dead and needed to be replaced or taken out. Not enough lounge chairs around the pool for the guests to use. One menu at the outside bar/food site... the outside bar to select food.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy99
Reviews.Content: I don't understand all of the negative reviews. The room we had at the resort was very nicely done. It was clean and while not huge was more than enough room for my family of three plus my mother and brother to be comfortable for two nights. We had a two bedroom room. There was a king bed and two twins plus a pull out sofa. All beds were clean and comfortable. The rooms had a screened in patio. The view wasn't great,, but we don't stay at a hotel for the views. The hotel is done in a safari theme, but we were so close to the Disney parks (5 min drive) that it went well with the Animal Kingdom. There are no elevators and we were on the second level, but the stairs were manageable for us. They could be more difficult for others. The pool was nice and the wooden trails around the place were nice, too. Overall a great place again and I would not hesitate to book a room there again!

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't believe how nice it was for the price!!”
Reviews.Author: Cavinsullivan
Reviews.Content: We booked his room last minute as our travel plans changed abruptly. When we arrived, we found the young lady at the front desk very pleasant and friendly. Although for some reason, they had no record of our reservation, they were very accomodating and even charged us a lower rate than I had booked online. We lucked into a first level room with walk out to the pool. The room was fantastic. It had two bedrooms with TV's, a full kitchen, two bath rooms, a large kitchen table, a large living room with flat screen and a DVD player. The master bedroom had a jacuzzi and a walk out patio. The pool was clean and very nice and had a nice atmosphere. They had activities for children throughout the day, an arcade and live music in the evening. There was a poolside bar that offered food. We ate there one night and the hamburger was one of the best I ever had!! What a pleasant surprise that was. W extended our stay two extra days. It was minutes away from Disney and all in all it was a great find. I would recomend it to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay with kids and family”
Reviews.Author: brimleyresident
Reviews.Content: i have stayed here 3 times now over the past 3 years, i think the value for the money is great, granted its not a 5 star resort but its at least a 3 and is very nice, ive been to places that had a hose stuck to your wallet and believe me this doesnt do that, it has a nice pool and play area for children and they have activities around the pool most days, my condo or suite was clean and we had ample room for 5 people, some of the reviews i read on here were less than desirable but if you want a nice place to stay and a place thats clean , centrally located near the parks and I-4 with numerous restrauants around and if you dont want to spend a fortune, then this is it, we booked ours thru hotels .com and got an excellent rate, in closing we will be going down here again in april and are staying here again,

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jandahiltner1
Reviews.Content: After reading the wide range of reviews on this resort, I wasn't sure what to expect. I'm usually an uber-planner, but I was a bit behind this vacation and my usual sure-bet choices for time share exchange were booked. We booked here by default; I read the reviews and hoped for the best. All in all, I was pleasantly surprised. We had a 2 BR 2 bath unit. In a nutshell: the place was clean, very clean. No weird smells. I never saw a bug, despite hypervigilance and having a unit on the ground floor. It was quiet. Never heard a neighbor despite the parking lot being pretty full. Outside painting was going on but it did not disrupt our stay. The decorating was pretty bad; luckily that's not why we were there. The staff was very polite. They ask you to fill out the customer satisfaction survey before they allow you to have the access code for the reduced rate internet connection, well before the complete discovery process has occurred. There were several non-functioning items in the unit-- a non-working outlet in the kitchen, a slightly leaky sink (just a bit of moisture on the floor after running the dishwasher,) and the icemaker was not hooked up. The condo is fairly dark, between the decor and the energy efficient light bulbs. The beds were very comfortable. The shower was strong and refreshing. My kids enjoyed the jacuzzi bathtub. The proximity to the parks was fantastic. If I was looking for a resort to serve more than a clean place to sleep and change, I would be dissapointed, however we were visiting Orlando to hit the parks and this place really met our needs. Elegant, no. Better than "basic", yes. The resort, in my opinion, is not a destination in itself, but that's not what we were looking for, so we were pleasantly surprised. True, we had to bring our own shampoo.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place...”
Reviews.Author: Thefamilyguy111
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed here based on the good reviews and I have to say we was not disappointed. It is tucked back away from the highway and you can walk to many places to eat and shop. Down just a little bit from old town. We purchased tickets for the dinner show Arabian nights which pretty cool. The staff is helpful and curtious. It is a timeshare resort but there was no pressure for us, just a nice relaxing week. The rooms are spacious and clean. They have everything you need to make you feel like your home away from home. Dont believe the negative things, some people just love to complain. Its a true bargain. We saved a ton of money staying here and going to the parks and could not have been happier with it! We will for sure stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “small and ok”
Reviews.Author: davsbabe
Reviews.Content: ok i'm not one to make a big deal over little things just read my other reviews. we had a 2 bed 2 bath unit. the 2 bed room 2 bath was ok, it only had twin beds in the 2en bedroom "not good" when you have two other adults that are large and need more space.the master bedroom was nice it had a king bed.the master bath was updated and very nice. the theam of the rooms were lions tigers and big game that was not realy bad,but if your not in to that theam then you don't want to stay here.if you love the theam you will love it here.we liked it so it did not bother us at all.now for the staff we did not get a mid week cleaning like you get at most time share resorts,so not only did i have to do our wash i had to do the resort was at our cost as we had to buy extra landury soap.then we had a tour we booked with disney and had to be up very early so we called the front desk the night before and asked for two wake up calls fifteen minutes apart, well we never got even one almost missed our tour we would have been out over 500 dollars good thing we set the clock as well.we did not walk the trail or eat at the resort so i can not give you info on that.one note the resort is very small no front gate not front desk staff late at night. any one could come and go as the please.the only time we seen any staff was when there was check in.we will not stay here even if we got it for free.. please under stand i'm very open minded so it's hard for me to be so mean but i don't want anyone to go through what we went through.if you do choose to stay here i hope you have a better time here then we did.good thing we got there late at night and left very early in the am so we only washed and slept there.

Reviews.Title: “don't be fooled by good reviews”
Reviews.Author: gheegheeme
Reviews.Content: First, when we arrived I had called ahead for a room facing the pool even if I had to take the third floor to have a nice view (the resort has no elevators). When we arrived, our view was........ the side of the next buildin, not even a glimpse of the pool. I climbed down the 3 flights of stairs and went to the front desk to complain. After complaining, we were switched to a 3rd floor room with a pool view. Finally inside our room, it was very dated and not too clean. I immediately killed a crawling bug on the kitchen floor. It had a musty odor, but a great view of the pool. The main area of the room is tiled and you will need to wear socks of shoes or else you will have dirty feet. I would recommend stripping your beds and immediately washing the bedding. The bedding at night didn't smell fresh when sleeping. The second bedroom has two twin beds and inside the closet is the hot water heated. Right outside the bedroom door is the furnace, needless to say, you don't get much sleep with all the noises from these two large units going off and on. The next morning I wanted to heat up my coffee after putting it in the microwave for 1 minute, then 2 minutes, then 10 minutes, I realized there was no heating my coffee. One evening, we wanted something to eat from the Kenya Kafe at around 6:20 p.m. When we called them we were told they are closing in 10 minutes. So when they say hours vary by day and season, it really means when they no longer want to serve their guests. The bar closes early around 7 p.m. So grab some cold beer from Publix if you want to drink something by the pool after a day at the parks. Also, the pool closes quite early and I saw security shooing guests back to their rooms around 10 p.m. It is true that this place is centrally located near many activities, food and disney parks, but it certainly isn't a 3 star, more like a 2 star resort. When I was checking out, a guest in front of me spoke in a low voice about a cockroach in their room. We spoke as she was leaving and she said they visit Florida often and realizes that this happens, but cockroaches can be controlled by the resort. Find a place with nicer ammenities, after all it is your vacation that you have anticipated going to for weeks after all the planning.

Reviews.Title: “another great stay at the parkway”
Reviews.Author: zoom8942
Reviews.Content: this was our second stay at the parkway international, and we had a wonderful time. The hotel is only minutes away from disney, and we got a great rate of $77 a night. We traveled with a teanage daughter, a preteen son, and a preeschooler. The parkway offered many kids activities durring the day, but we spent much of the day at disney. we spent the evenings in the great heated pool,which was warm enough even for me to swim(im a wimp) There was definately an older crowd so there really was no other children to interact with? the time of year or just the crowd the parkway attracts. thay were referbishing the hot tub that week(bummer) The room have plenty of space to hang out. I do wish houskeeping would come in once a week and clean, as by the end of the week the floors were quite dirty, dont know quite why. kitchen is fully stocked,and washer/dryer though small helped alot. they were powerwashing/painting all the units which was loud, but we were gone most of the day anyway, so it didnt really affect us, unlike the previous poster. I guess they have to be able to referbish sometimes, and at $77 a night who can complain!!!!!!!! do wish they had free wifi

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: debpurn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Parkway the week of Feb 20th. Checked in a few hours early with no problem. I was pleasantly surprised when I saw the unit due to the descriptions I had read regarding the decor. There was definitely enough space for myself, husband and 9 year old son. I am always worried about noise when travelling and I never heard any of our neighbors. Slept great every night. Our unit was near the playground so we didn't hear any noise from the pool area. We spent most of our time away from the resort so I can't comment on the pool or activities. The location was perfect. Parking was not an issue here like other resorts we have stayed at in Orlando. My only 2 gripes would be the shower was small and the tvs in the bedrooms need to be upgraded. But I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, fun, and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Raboine
Reviews.Content: The weather was a little on the cooler side, but the resort had plenty of indoor activities to keep us busy, too (plus a great hot tub!). Becky, the activities director was super friendly and made everyone feel welcome. I had never played all the variations of bingo that she organized but helped me understand and I even won the big pot at the end! It was so much fun that I went back for blackjack, too. Manny, the bartender, makes some delicious margaritas, too, so you'll definitely have to have to split a pitcher or two :) The tennis courts were really nice and up to date. The room itself was beautiful. You could tell everything was less than a couple years old, and I loved all the diamond patterned tile everywhere. We look forward to returning next year!

Reviews.Title: “Something for all 3 generations!”
Reviews.Author: sandeebeech
Reviews.Content: Everything in our condo was clean and very comfortable. The outdoor property was free of litter and maintained on a daily basis. True, there is no maid service but clean towels, soaps, and other housekeeping necessities are available at the main desk. Parking was directly in front of the units. Daily activities were provided for the children down by the pool. Outdoor/pool chairs and tables/umbrellas were clean and in good condition. We found all personnel very polite and ready to assist us if needed. The exercise room was a little on the small size, but it was never crowded and often empty. We took advantage of the outdoor gas grills and used one to cook our dinner one night. My only complaint would be the size of the second bedroom in our condo - the master bedroom was perfect, the second bedroom was very small...which was fine for kids, but not adults. I would recommend this resort to friends -- all 3 of us enjoyed our six day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: dolphindream88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Parkway International Resorts from Feb 15-22nd & we loved it. From the outside of the buildings it looks kind of run down, but once we walked into our room we were very impressed. The 2 bedroom/2 bath condo was perfect for us traveling with a 11 & 15 yr old & the rooms are spaced out for privacy. Having our own in suite washer & dryer was awesome. It was great to be able to wash clothes & towels whenever we wanted to. We had great service from the hotel when the chain to flush the toilet broke in the master bath, maintaince was there to fix it within a hour of us reporting it to the front desk. We were only approached once to attend the time share presentation & it was by a phone call, all we said was we were just heading out to the parks & they just said thank you & did not press us any furthur. We checked in late at night so the front desk had told us to return the next morning to receive our offical parking pass, but we just used the same one they gave us at check in and we had no problems, i just think it is a way they can ask you to attend the time share presentation in person. Would be willing to stay here again on another visit to Orlando

Reviews.Title: “Pool, Hot tub & Tiki bar Close Super Early!”
Reviews.Author: luvthesun33
Reviews.Content: Things to know before you go: Wireless Internet doesn't work well at all, pool chlorine is high, pool, hot tub, and tiki bar close Early, security insure that everyone is in by 10pm which We didn't like because after all your on vacation. Also the pool area gets kinda crowed early so get there early to reserve your spot or bring your own lawn chair. The room was nice & clean perfect for us four. I enjoyed the spa tub in the master bedroom but another lady I met said hers was super loud. There are no elevators that didn't bother us a bit and we were on the top floor but just a heads up incase you have someone in your party that can't handle the stairs. The trails were nice but don't really lead to anything (no shopping, dinning). All the staff were very helpful & kind. At check in they were happy to move us close to the pool area. The kids enjoyed the play area. The game room was fun on a day when it rained a bit. We enjoyed a game of shuffle board. Overall we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “We've found our place in Orlando to stay!”
Reviews.Author: steph774
Reviews.Content: We traveled w/our kids ages 4 & 2 & my in-laws for a 2 night stay at Parkway International. It was a wonderful stay! It is a timeshare resort but we declined the "breakfast invitation" & they didn't press on any further. The rooms are very big & VERY clean! I was most excited about the cleanliness-I couldn't find any fault. We loved having a full kitchen with pots & pans & 2 bathrooms. I can't say how the service is at the front desk if you were to need something, b/c we only stayed 2 nights. It was perfect & we'll definitely be back! OH & eat at Charley's Steakhouse right next door-best steak i've ever had!
