Reviews.Title: “Hmmm... this is a tough one.”
Reviews.Author: LadyFan55
Reviews.Content: First let me say that we own at Parkway International, but I am going to make every effort to give an objective review. We were also there during a week of poor weather, although we travelers may not realize it, the weather can tilt our opinion, but I will try and not have that affect my review either. We had one week on deposit with the Resort program itself that was going to expire soon so my husband and I decided to use it for our first vacation without our boys in 15 years. (It was also the 1st time we stayed here at our home resort). For this purpose the 2 bedroom suite was a perfect size, we did not use the 2nd bedroom but the 2nd bath was a nice plus, but if we would have had our 3 boys with us, it would have been tight for us. There were not many draws offered in the master bedroom either. General info: This is a mature resort, old is not the right word as the units were all re-done within the last 5-6 years. The first building done (the building we stayed in and own in, "C") shows the most wear. The guests who stay at Parkway are also more mature than many other places we have stayed, some in age, all in behavior, some both. With that said it is also a great place for kids with many activities. Maybe not the best place for singles and those who enjoy a "night-life" or "partying" atmosphere. It has a laid back, festive feel, but not rowdy. Staff was fine, they where neutral about us and we were neutral about them. M-F they offer coffee, orange juice, packaged muffins or bagels, granola bars and packages of oatmeal. Not a full continental breakfast by any means, but we made good use of it. All units are 2b/2b with a king size bed in the master and 2 twins in the 2nd bedroom. I understand they can prep some rooms to have 2 king beds by putting the twins together for you. There is a mini W&D, full kitchen, dining room, living room and a screened in patio. The suite has outside entry both in front and back - loved that! The rooms are decorated in an African Motif. Nothing showed much, if any, wear and tear but neither was it "fresh" or "brand new". Well appointed kitchen. Wireless I-net is free if you own here and maybe if you own at any Island One resort, but it was pretty darn slow, even with a strong signal. The breakfast/lunch spiel after you check in and are getting your parking pass is a timeshare tour for Vacation Village at Parkway, the neighboring Resort, we own there too. We bought our 2b/2b there from private owners, but we did do the timeshare tour at VV@P about a year ago and it was one of the most horrible experiences of our life, we will never do it again! This is a timeshare resort and like all the timeshare resorts we have stayed in, daily housekeeping does not come standard, so be prepared to make your own bed. Supplies we found in our room: TP Paper Towels Kleenex Trash Bags Liquid dish detergent 2 single size packs of dishwasher detergent 1 single size washing machine detergent (we use and are happy with the 2-n-1 wash & dry sheets) 1 Caf & 1 D-caf coffee Sugar/Sweetener packages & powered creamer packages Small soap bars Pros: • Location, location, location - just east of I-4, it is only minutes from Disney and a short jog up I-4 to Seaworld, Discovery Cove, Universal, etc. Publix is just a couple blocks west and about every place you can imagine to eat is within a 5 minute drive. • Quiet - you might think that a resort so close to a main drag and interstate would have a traffic noise problem, but the lush vegetation totally insulates out all traffic noise! • Attractive grounds - really one of the best, mostly natural landscapes we have seen. The nature walk is a nice bonus too! • Awesome jetted tub, but do not care for it's location. I like the configuration of having a nice jetted tub where you view the bedroom and the TV versus the bathroom and bowl. • Very pretty pool area and finally a true Hot Tub! • Comfy bed but the pillows where a little too plump for me. • Not a single bug in sight. Cons: • In an effort to conserve energy, they go way over board using the energy efficient light bulbs making the entire unit way too dark! I finally had to just start leaving lights on so as to not have to wait for them to "warm up". • Carpet in the living room. We prefer tile. Regardless if it looks dirty or not, I always "feel" like carpet is dirty unless it is brand new. • No door on the laundry area so you could not close off the sound of the w&d. • TV - The size in the living room is fine, the one in the master is small (sorry, forgot to look at the 2nd b.r.), but the worst thing is the lack of selection. Only the most basic channels. Why does TV matter when in Orlando? Well when it rains, or is cold and you can't hit the pool after a day at the parks, it might be nice to wind down with a decent movie, not possible here unless you like only the oldies. But, with that said, the current rack rates to stay here may be worth the trade off. • Pool was too cool for the season, we could have swam if it where warmer. We visited the Resort where we will be staying Dec of 2011 and tested the pool temp there, it was very warm and swimmable even with weather barley hitting 60º. • The exercise room is sad, depressing and packed with way to much stuff! I love to work out, but I walked in then right back out. The resort is above "Average" but "Very Good" is not quite right either. Wish I could give it 3 1/2 stars = "Good".

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay here!! Will absolutely return!!”
Reviews.Author: wiscgrandma
Reviews.Content: Have been to Orlando six times and this is by far the best accomodations we have ever had. Our Garmin GPS took us right to it. Having such a huge room was wonderful, especially with a family of six in one of the rooms. The kitchen was large and had everything I looked for to cook meals from pots and pans, baking pans/sheets, utensils, dishes, silverware, etc. Had a hand mixer, blender, coffee maker, sandwich grill, knife block, cutting board. My family enjoyed the whirlpool tub in the master bathroom, but there was also a walk in shower in there. They accomodated us by placing our two families next door to each other. We had a ground floor room which was good with little children and a 7-8 months pregnant woman (note-no elevators!). Having a washer and dryer was wonderful and soap was provided for it as well as for the dishwasher and dishsoap. No, there is no shampoo provided but soap was provided. Parking was right outside the door. There were tennis courts and a pool area which the kids used and enjoyed. There is a little strip mall behind the hotel with a grocery store and restaurants. The grounds were clean and beautiful. We were located in the building furthest from the front office and it was very nice and quiet there. When we arrived they told us after we signed in (and had provided our vehicle information) that we needed to go into a side room and get our 'permanent parking pass' from a gentleman but we politely declined and walked out of the lobby (we got no parking tickets while there either!) No one called us to ask us to a "breakfast", etc, until the day we were leaving and then they apologized for calling when told them we were checking out. Everyone was polite. I can see no point in buying into this time share as the rates were excellent to just rent and not have the other hassle/obligation. The location is excellent-easy to get in and out of and it is close to all main attractions. We have found the place we will always stay on our future visits!!

Reviews.Title: “Good size rooms”
Reviews.Author: MollyAust
Reviews.Content: Not a bad place to stay for the money. Probably will need a car to get to the hotel. Staff pleasant and the rooms clean but starting to show there age. Our room not ready so we were changed to a poolside room. Wouldn't recommend staying in one of these as the noise from the bar, pool and the music from7 in the morning is a bit much. We were there in winter and the cleaners cranked the music up when cleaning early in the morning! Ove ll a good place to stay with easy access to all the theme parks and local shopping. Great having a kitchen to be able to prepare our own food.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms for the price! Not too bad if you don't mind a couple cockroaches.”
Reviews.Author: usmcdevildog
Reviews.Content: PROS: - Huge Rooms - Decent Price - One of the closest off Disney property hotels - Jacuzzi tub in master bath - On site playground - 3 televisions - Kitchen with utensils - Washer/Dryer in room with detergent - No cleaning crews to disturb you if you sleep late CONS: - Checked in around 9:00 PM, was told to come back to the concierge desk in the morning for a "Parking Pass." I came back at 7 AM (when they told me they opened) and the front desk said they wouldn't be in until noon. I wasn't going to rearrange my schedule to go get a "parking pass" for the hotel I was staying at. I never got one and my car was amazingly enough still there every morning. - Front desk is closed from 11:00 PM to 7:00 AM. Had to check out at 4:00 AM to catch an early flight. Left keys in room, good thing I didn't need a receipt! I don't know how anyone would check-in if they got there late at night. - "Continental breakfast" (oatmeal packets and stale granola bars) only served Mon-Fri - No shampoo - Only had 1 1/2 rolls of toilet paper between the 2 bathrooms - Had a couple cockroaches in our room Even though there are quite a few cons, I would stay here again if I was able to get a decent price. I would not want to be an owner (it is a timeshare property) nor would I pay the full regular nightly price.

Reviews.Title: “Just an okay place”
Reviews.Author: MLK58
Reviews.Content: Not a warm and friendly check-in, but not rude either. Quick and efficient. The whole place needs to be cleaned better, especially the floors. The kitchen needs a new toaster and could use a new coffee maker also, but it had everything needed including soaps for dishes, dishwasher and washing machine, paper towels, tissues, etc. The beds were comfortable enough, but the sheets and pillow cases didn't smell real fresh, although they seemed clean. The pool area was very nice, although there was hardly anyone there, so don't know what it would be like if it were full. I guess the best thing about the place is it's location. Very close to parks as well as downtown Orlando. Not sure if I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Expected much more....”
Reviews.Author: biged
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for two weeks. I heard glowing reports about the place. I would definitley NOT rate this place higher than 3 stars ( if that ). Rude and uncaring front desk ( and an obnoxious game host ) were a few of the problems. Some of the should-be-obvious things were not taken care of : Towels and linens were never replaced, unless begged for, and the garbage problem ( they never said what to do with the garbage, although I specifically said you can come into the rented space and take the garbage ). A leaky showerhead was replaced quickly. The place was old. Not dirty, but old with no elevators ( no big deal ). Mirrors and lion wallpaper everywhere. Just not my cup of tea. I also learned that January is not a good month to go swimming ( my bad ). I felt like once they got you there, they forgot about you. I would rate this place between 2 and 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: hephzibahs
Reviews.Content: Great Place to stay. About 20 minutes away from Universal Studios. The room sizes are pretty good. 2 Bedroom and a jacuzzi in the Master's Bathroom! Full kitchen with silverware and dishes, coffee machine, grinder. Also has washer and dryer, which comes in handy. Master's bedroom leads to balcony. There is also a nature trail that leads to a little shopping center. The trail is beautiful. The king size bed is very comfortable and huge! Would definitely stay again. Tvs in the room could use an upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “In the Middle of Everything!”
Reviews.Author: kimmy5504
Reviews.Content: We spend 5 nights and 6 days at this resort. Since our plane arrived late, we had to have security check us in. No problems! The unit has 2 bedrooms, 2 baths, a kitchen, living room, and washer/dryer in the unit. The resorts offer a complimentary continental breakfast daily (M-F) in the lobby. This resort is so close to the parks! There is a Publix supermarket close by. Across the street is the town of Celebration. We were never pressured into a timeshare presentation. The pool is very basic and there is a playground for the kids next to the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money & perfect location !”
Reviews.Author: vhoney
Reviews.Content: Two bedroom apartment for just the two of us - so much space. Full kitchen which was very useful. Very clean. Decor not to everyone's taste but not old. Perfect location for the parks & International Drive. An abundance of restaurants on US192 also - some of them within walking distance. Do Charley's Steakhouse & Kissimee Swamp Tours.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay with kids.”
Reviews.Author: jtmadisonct
Reviews.Content: This is a comfortable large suite with 2 full bedrooms. A kitchen with all the pots/pans/dishes you can ask for. Washer and drier in the unit, tv' in every room. The location is perfect. You could not get any closer to the parks. It is nice to have a home base for young kids to call home while away. You can cook a homemade breakfast, make sandwiches to take to the parks, and put a load of laundry in before you leave for the day. In my opinion, it is better than being cramped into a single room with 2 beds with no privacy which you might find on-site at a cheap resort place. Don't forget to go to Fioni's Italian restaurant right down the street. Perfect home style cooked meal. We loved it there. We needed a home-style meal after all the park food. The BBQ up the street at Fat Boys is good too. Oh yeah, ask for Everett at the resort. He will help you out with anything. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Rude Front Desk Agent!”
Reviews.Author: skikid553
Reviews.Content: Everything was going really well. Clean condo, quite large, no elevator so if you have trouble with stairs stay on the bottom level. The bad thing was that we went away for a couple of days and when we came back we tried to log onto the internet and could not because we did not have the code. So I called the front desk on 12/8/10 at 6pm and got a man who basically said I did not know what I was talking about.....we paid 29.99 for a weeks worth of internet to which the woman who checked us in gave us the code, but according the man at the front desk, no one there gave us a code, they don't do that at the front desk!!! So I wonder how I got the code to get in, when I began questioning the man he hung up on me!!!! so much for customer service at this resort. Also just to let you know, I did find the code that the woman at the front desk gave me upon check in and this is how I am typing this right now.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: JENNMCC
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the condo/resort. The unit was very large and clean. Shampoo may not have been provided, but all of the kitchen needs were there, soap for dishwasher, washing machine, and sink. Extra paper products were also on the counter, along with packs of sunblock. Natural sunlight was not easy to come by in our unit but we weren't in the room that often. It did seem dark though. The screened in porch was nice and it was great to leave the door open to let the fresh air in. There is also a back door to the unit which is unique. The pool was nice and plenty big. There was plenty of shade so you didn't have to be in the sun all of the time. We didn't go to the cafe, but we did take our own water to the pool and saw plenty of people with outside food and drink. They have daily activities for the kids and adults. There is a work out room, didn't use it but it looked ok. We did pay for the internet for the week much bettter deal than paying daily fee. The location is great, easy to get to the airport or 4. Our biggest concern was that they were going to bug us about buying into the timeshare. They do try and talk to you when you get there to get something set up, we were in a hurry and made it clear we didn't have time to set anything up and they never bothered us the rest of the week. Would for sure here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Brentpen
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. Very convenient to Disney, Seaworld and lots of restaurants. Had friends staying on disney and one night we left Ainimal Kingdom at same time. We were back at Parkway before the disney shuttle had our friends back at their resort. Wal-Mart is about 10 minutes away(driving) and Super Target and a Publix grocery store even closer.Nike outlet within walking distance as well as some restaurants. Found the pool to be a good size. Staff were friendly and helpful. Laundy, dishwasher and dish detergent were supplied. Liked the place so much goinng back in early 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable beds, close to Disney, but no shampoo in the bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: TheOneWhoLovesTravel
Reviews.Content: The resort is nicely located near Disney. You do need to be careful with GPS as you may end up missing exits to get there. The resort has several buildings surrounding nice size and depth pool. There also buildings outside of pool areas, which are good when you want some privacy. The parking is free, but internet is $29 for a week (not bad, but I prefer it to be included). The pool area has a pool bar, children playground, and nicely equipped arcade room (coin-operated). They have some walking passes, but no fitness center. The only pool rule was that you could not bring outside food and beverages, but had to buy those from the pool bar, which is very strange. The two-bedroom suite was spacious, full-sized kitchen, large living room, a private balcony overlooking gardens, DVD player (movies are charge), flat-screen TV in the living rooms, and older TVs in bedrooms. The master bedroom has a king bed with soft mattress and duvet, large bathroom with shower and Jacuzzi, smaller toilet. The other bedroom and bathrooms were a bit smaller and there were two European-style beds there (hence International name?), which are only good for pre-teenagers. The only other omission was complete absence of shampoo. When we asked at the service desk they told us that the were not a hotel to carry the shampoo, but a resort. We went to nearby Radisson hotel, where two shampoo bottles were complimentary given to us by their front desk shocked to learn that the Parkway International did not have any shampoo. As a time-sahre resort, they also asked us to come to 'learn about the resort', which we declined and they called every day and left messages; otherwise, they were not much pushy on the issue. The check out was good and they even printed airline boarding passes. Except the shampoo and odd pool rule, the resort is very nice for its class. we really liked the king bed and the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Depend on your GPS”
Reviews.Author: Ozad7880
Reviews.Content: Like all the previous posts, a great place to stay in. Close to everything you could want to make your stay enjoyable and memorable. Only thing I could add for those traveling there for the first time, is to search for hotel name rather than the address. The address took us around in circles to no avail. When we called, we were told to go across from the Radisson on Parkway Ave. Found it easy.

Reviews.Title: “great place i will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: nivo25
Reviews.Content: it was really a great vacation the room was clean & comfortable we have been in the 2 bedroom villa it was big & we was 5 persons with a baby the babycot was great for my baby, the location also was great it took only about 10 min to reach all the parks, it was a great hotel i will stay there the next time if u need to enjoy go to parkway international hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation EVER!”
Reviews.Author: jrbjhb
Reviews.Content: Based on Tripadvisor ratings we booked for the Parkway International through II almost a year in advance. Was it because we booked so early? I don't know but we got a unit RIGHT by the pool and our entire group just LOVED it. The 3 year old keeps asking to go back. There is a decided family atmosphere with entertainment provided part of the afternoon and on Saturday night. [If you need a nap in the afternoon request a place away from the pool/entertainment area. It can be a little noisy when they do kareoke with a mike, but otherwise is well insulated from outside noise.] There are restaurants all over and it is very close to Disney World. The three year old LOVED the nice playground and the nature walk which is quite extensive...a nice 8 or 9 minute resort board walk that takes you through real Florida "jungle" to a convenience store area that has restaurants as well. I loved the apartment and the pool, both of which were sparkling clean and the staff was as nice as could be. It is clear they aim to please and cheerfully provide you with extra towels, garbage sacks, or whatever as needed. Like most resorts they offer you a sales "tour" with freebies attached, but were nice when we declined. We have learned from experience that the time these tours take from your vacation are not worth it. We hosted our son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren and there was plenty of room for everybody. My daughter-in law kept remarking on how nice it all was and how well designed the apartment was. We used the washer and dryer and went home with clean clothes. They have nice, clean gas barbeques and make a maintenace man available to start one up for you whenever you want. We used it twice and saved on eating out. The kitchens have everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! Wouldn't change a thing!”
Reviews.Author: Jcarerros
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but positive things to say about this place. We will stay here everytime we come!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, close to all the parks”
Reviews.Author: CaribbeanTim
Reviews.Content: Our 3rd time to PI and still a great place. We love having the condo feel being that we have 3 kids. Them having a separate room is what I wish we could get everywhere. The pool is not huge, but certainly adequate. The playground is great for the kids to run off steam too. We love being 5-10 minutes away from the Disney parks at this resort. The one thing we did not like this time or any of the other times is that they will not let you check in early. You have to wait around until 3-4 when they say the rooms are supposed to be done, maybe next time we will be able to get in a little early.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Location, Service”
Reviews.Author: maggiemagoo
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Disney World with our 9 year old grand daughter. Exchanged a one bedroom time share in Aruba for this suite. Location was fabulous..minutes from Disney. Rooms were spacious and had all the amenities you need. Our room overlookede the pool. The bartenders, Norm and Greg, were great as were front desk staff, Kenney and Megan. Pool was clean, staff was helpful and pleasant. Lots of restaurants within driving distance, some within walking. Pulbix market just down the road. Older units, but well maintained. We were very pleased with the entire experience and would stay there again on the next trip to WDW.

Reviews.Title: “Great place! Would definately stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: keewart
Reviews.Content: Just got back tonight from a week at Parkway International. Went with another mom and our 14 year old boys. Accomodations were perfect for us! Recently renovated, new kitchen cabinets, new GE appiances, stacked washer and dryer, tiled baths. The linens we had on the bed differ from the pictures....we had a white double sheeted down comforter (more like a down blanket) with a runner at the bottom, not a bed spread (this was much better). Some of the towels were a little thin, but we just used the other fluffier ones. The jungle theme is used quite a bit, although I wouldn't want it in my house, it was tastefully done. 2 flat panel tvs, one in the LR and one in the master BR. Another tv in the 2nd BR. We timed it: 3 minutes from our door to the Hollywood Studios entrance! Only a little longer to the other parks. The location can't be beat. The boys loved the Nike outlet that you could literally walk to. Prime Outlets are only several exits away on I4. Publix grocery is a very short drive away. The boys loved having their own bed and bathroom. Although they didn't go to the pool, the moms did and enjoyed afternoon drinks at the pool bar several afternoons. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here at all. If you are looking for a place with expansive lush grounds or golf course, you may want to look somewhere else, but this 2BR 2BA timeshare fit our needs and I felt more than comfortable staying there. I slept great every night. The other mom slept on the sleeper sofa and she said she slept great each night, too.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like coming home!!!”
Reviews.Author: JudeEmersonPark
Reviews.Content: We own two weeks here but came over for three. Weather wasn't warm but sunny and bright, though we did have 4 days in which the temperature was over 65deg. Nice enough to walk round Epcot and Hollywood studios comfortably and the other two days around the pool. We come back to our resort every 2 - 3 years. It is so convenient for everything, the apartments are kept beautifully and you have the presence of security guards keeping an eye out. We did a big shop at Publix so spent a few nights in. The other shopping was fantastic, had to buy another case.! We spent a few evenings over at Celebration Village and because we have been over so often its so easy to get from place to place. We hired a large car as friends from New York joined us for a few days, they love Parkway too! The staff are so very helpful and you don't get continuous phone calls or pressure to buy timeshare there. We have owned since 1990 and have not been disappointed once on our visits to Florida. The next time we go, we are hoping to take our grandsons who at the moment are 2yrs and 5months respectively. There is so much to see and do all within a 10 minute drive. Probably won't be back there for about another 3 years or so but know it will be like coming home!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place for a family visiting WDW”
Reviews.Author: GeorgemTexas
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed here for 8 nights in June 2009. We had a two bedroom two bath condo. The youngest one slept on the bed which pulls out of the sofa. We were very pleased. The pictures on the web site are mostly accurate. It is about a 10 minute drive to the WDW parking lots. The kitchen is a decent size. The pool area is nice enough for the kids, but not memorable. Did not bother to get our "parking pass" from the condo sales folks. Just made sure the security folks were OK with that. Never answered the phone either. Thus, zero sales pressure. We'll stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “All round excellent”
Reviews.Author: DJC026
Reviews.Content: I have actually stayed here a few times, April 2007 was the last time I went with my girlfriend, now wife. We had a two bedroom apartment, with 2 bathrooms, lounge and kitchen area. The units are excellent in cleanliness and space, we could have easily had 4 people in there and with the pull out bed in the living area, 6. The unit also came with a balcony, which had a net to stop mosquitos getting into the rooms. The kitchen comes with all the utensils such as kettle, toaster etc. The rooms are well decorated (its based on a jungle theme) and it is very much like living in a home away from home. Outside of the unit there are 'safari walks' around the wooded areas, which are pleasant. There is a kids area with slide and swings and a small games area with a couple of arcade games. This backs on to the pool area, which is a large pool and a couple of spa baths. There is also a bar area around the pool, which does serve food too. The resort also has a small gym and tennis court. It is generally a quiet place reagrdless of business, the staff helpful and well maintained throughout. The location of the resort is excellent, near restaurants and shops and all the major parks. We would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “This place is wonderful , will be back for sure”
Reviews.Author: WinnipegDonna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from dec31 to jan 10 , 2010 .I was actually scared before we got there as it seemed too good to be true for the price . Seeing the pictures didnot reassure me as I have stayed places before and the pictures of the place don't even reseble the hotel . In this case it was even better and nicer than the pics.Location was great , all comforts of home and didn't hace to take dirty laundry home .Beautiful well kept grounds ,very nice staff and security. also didn't hear neibour noise.We will be staying at this hotel again in 2 yrs when we return.having a nice place to come back too after being a tourist for 12 hrs a day with tired feet , was very comforting .comfy bed too .Thankyou for helping our vactation a perfect one .

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: kr7757
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one week. It was clean and neat. I would stay again. The staff was pleasant and no one tried to sell me anything. The check in was fast and pleasant. The only con to my stay was the singer by the pool was much to loud and awful. Also there is no elevator, we had to climb to flights of stairs with our luggage. However, the condo was great and I loved the screened-in patio and washer and dryer. The location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Just Great”
Reviews.Author: monicacaguas
Reviews.Content: I stayed 6 nights with my husband and two kids (9 and 10) . I was worried about some web sites bad reviews but because of the low price I take the chance and was wonderfull. The location is excellent just minutes to the Disney parks and near restaurants and stores (GREAT). The check in was fast (we always arrive after check in time). The villa is BIG . The kids have their own room, their own bed, their own bathroom , their own TV so, they were happy and we too.The master room is very spacious, the bed is comfortable the master bathroom have a jetted whirpool. The kitchen is very clean and well equipped , the washer and dryer works very well. My villa was a first floor has I requested (thank for the tip) with a great pool view and a balcony . The least I liked was that our second floor neighboors footstep wake up us at 7:00am. Every morning at the lobby there were complimentary coffe and snacks. Pool area is clean, and very pretty. GREAT VALUE AND A GREAT STAY. People dont stay at a hotel room.This type of resort have everything and a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: MancieWestVirginia
Reviews.Content: This resort was located in one of the best spots you could ask for. It was so close to Disney, resturants and downtown disney. The resort was so quiet and a pleasure to talk to anyone you come across. The staff was great to help you with any of your needs and so friendly. The only thing the I would change if possible is that we stay for two weks instead of one. I sure we will return

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home”
Reviews.Author: NorwegianMama
Reviews.Content: We having been traveling to the Disney area for over 15 years with our extended family and we have always chosen to stay at Parkway. When other family members have stayed at more " fancy " resorts we have all ended up hanging out at Parkway. It is not a very large resort and has a very nice pool area. It has a great location, easy drive to everything. I feel comfortable telling our teenage children and their younger cousins to go hang out at the pool. We have always been lucky and had a room on the lower level near the pool. The room is always clean with plenty of room. The kitchen is well stocked with supplies, because we always cook breakfast and dinner at the resort. The activities offered Thursday thru Sunday and enjoyable. The kids love Bingo and the adults love blackjack. We paid only 80 dollars a night for our last visit, a great deal, even in the off season. We feel very comfortable and safe at this hotel. They were also very nice and let us in our room early at 1100 am, as someone on our trip was sick. They also rearranged rooms to put our family all near one another in the same building without us requesting it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - will come back!”
Reviews.Author: OntarioHopper
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 days while visiting the Disney parks and absolutely loved the condo and area. We were on the ground floor facing the pool and playground which was great with kids. The condos are at least 10 years old but they were clean and very spacious. Two big bathrooms and bedrooms and tons of space to store your things (much better than a hotel for a week). It had everything we needed. The pool was nice and clean and never busy. The rooms were VERY quiet/soundproof and we never heard our neighbors. Our son was in the back bedroom which is close to the airconditioning and hot water unit and he did complain a bit that they were noisy but we didn't notice. The fitness center was small...my husband used it and said there was only 2 treadmills and an exercise bike and stairclimber with weights. It's a 3 minute walk to a few good restaurants (loved the Kobe Steak house) and a 5 minute walk to Starbucks. Just ten minute drive to Premium Outlet and the Publix grocery store is a five minute drive to pick up breakfast foods and snacks. Our only warning - fight off the time share people with a stick! My husband got sucked in...they promised us breakfast and a $100 visa gift card for only one hour of our time. 90 minutes later after a dry bagel and old piece of fruit, we had to firmly say NO and then they were suddenly very curt and unfriendly. We did get the gift card after another 30 minute wait and it wasn't worth the hassle. Just say no when you check in and the resort itself is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good stay”
Reviews.Author: Traveller from UK
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the resort for six nights and had a mostly positive experience. There were a few little niggles starting with when we tried to check-in. We knew we were a bit early but the woman on reception was quite curt and kept telling us there was no way we could enter our apartment until the proper check-in time of 4.00pm as it wasn't ready. Because it was only 2.15 pm we accpeted this but....at no time during the next 2 hours did anybody go near our apartment as we parked outside it to wait!!!! The decor is indeed a little dated but the apartments are great value for money and are well equipped with everything you could possibly want. Maid service is available but we didn't use it. However, the floors (we think it was the carpets) were filthy and we my husband's white socks were soon black!!! While we were there the pool was closed for renovations for two days which was a nuisence to say the least. We were able to use the pool at the condos next door but it was quite a long walk and by early afternoon, the pool there was in shade. Overall we had a very nice stay and would probably return as it is such good value. We were not bothered at all by any time-share people. These apartments

Reviews.Title: “Great value. Comfortable and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: scm5g
Reviews.Content: Was a great place to stay with family to visit Disney. Next best thing to staying in the park. It was very close. It was clean and comfotable. Decor was a little dated, but nothing was shabby. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Close To Disney- Kissimmee, FL”
Reviews.Author: ldorrn
Reviews.Content: This is a condo with two bedrooms/ two bath, full kitchen, washer/ dryer, screen porch with table, 3 t.v.'s with dvd player, living room, diner table, front and back door. We were going to Disney and had friends there in Florida and they stayed with us there. ( No extra person charges.) This was a GREAT price and it would be great for a family. Master bed room was large with king size bed, a large bathroom, 2nd bed room had 2 twin beds and a sofa bed as well in the living room. It had a nice enclosed playground for the kids/ nice pool with bar. If your nasty and can't clean up after yourself and need maid service this is not for you. (thou, I do think you can add daily maid service If you want) If you want a large condo and not a two room hotel at a great price this is it. The room was VERY CLEAN! As were the grounds as well. Wire-less Internet was not free :( , about $10 a day. But, ther was a Starbucks just up the street if you want free internet with a good cup of coffee. :) Everything you need is in the kitchen, plates, flatware, glasses. They did have snack type stuff for free at breakfast at the front desk area. Golden Coral Restarant was the best deal for breakfast, when eating out. Looks like it cost more up front but you get a MUCH better selection of better food and all the juice you want in the price. Everywhere you go the prices were the same for breakfast by the time you walk out the door. For all-you-can-eat lobster and snow crab there is a place just down the main drag to the left of the light. Mike's or Bob's something like that. The food was great and the people and service were even better!!! There's another one at a hotel , we tried both, this one is better by far! They'll show you how th get the tail out of the lobsin about 2 seconds! And then just eat till you pop! LOL The people at the Condo were very nice and they exchange lien on wenesdays or sooner if you ask. It felt more like home than a hotel, which I liked. We rented a car which was nice. I think a bus service runs to disney from the main road about t 1 1/2 - 2 blocks away. But, I'm not sure. Parking at Disney was $12 a day. No discount or multi day passes for parking (which I didn't like Mickey!!!). We had 5 day passes to the parks. Only a few more dollars each day after the first 3 days. You can take in bottled drinks as of this writting in like a butt bag and snacks. (Freeze the bottled water the night before.) All bags are looked in at the entrance at Disney. Get FAST PASSES for rides. They're free. Have fun! :)

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: gennie09
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay at the resort with my spouse, our daughter and our five year old grandson. We had a marvelous time. The resort is everything that we expected and more. Quiet, close to parks, restaurants, shopping, clean, clean, clean, specious unit, friendly service. Prior to booking, I had researched the resort (had stayed in Liki Tiki previously), but wanted something closer to I-4, knew that it was a time share resort, didn't have daily "maid service", didn't have an elevator or other "perks" that some of other reviews complained about. We were on the third floor overlooking the pool (at our request). We didn't have a problem putting on a dishwasher or a washer before either heading down to the pool or out the parks. Our grandson especially liked the decour of the unit and the resort - he calls it the "jungle". Couple of minor complaints, if any, (1) trying to get you to commit to attending a timeshare presentation (although they don't tell you that's what it is) the following morning, as you are picking up your parking pass - a firm NO did the trick. (2) The vanity in the master bathroom (at least in this unit) is very small. No room to put anything on the counter and no shelving (except for space underneath the sink). The shower is on the small size, however, the jetted tub is huge. The vanity in the second bathroom is larger with additional shelving. Overall, there is plenty of storage space. We are definately looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe GOLD CROWN back in the day!”
Reviews.Author: cage94
Reviews.Content: This is obviously an older timeshare resort. Don't get me wrong. The rooms themselves were a refresher after pulling in. The place is a victim of times. We are use to the newer resorts (We enjoy Marriotts). And this place has done a good job trying to keep up. I wouldn't say I would never stay here again but it certainly is not my top 5 in choices. We like to get on the top floor anywhere we go. This place will accommodate you with that. Why? NO ELEVATORS. BEWARE. I'm a fairly young man and was able to do it ok. But I wouldn't want to again. I like elevators. I do not like to work to hard on vacation. Even with elevators I might (maybe say it was a silver crown). But let me say that the actual rooms themselves we pretty good. I did not like them having 2 entrance doors. Especially with toddlers running around. They try to get you to do the timeshare thing. Beware. We know how to handle it. So come prepared. Had a pretty good trip though. Pool is okay. Like I said this place is just a victim of the times.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, and CLEAN!”
Reviews.Author: ReviewReaderMom
Reviews.Content: We traveled with our 3 year old and 3 of the grandparents for our 1st disney experience. We own a time share in another state and opted to trade this year for our trip to Orlando. As it goes with timeshares...what you see is not always what you get (or what they sell to you!). Over the years I have found that you really need to carefully check out the places you trade for because so many of them are crap, run down, and filthy. I am admittedly neurotic about where we stay when we vacation and I spend countless hours (much to my husband's dismay) researching and reading mutiple reviews from many sites before I commit. Of course I like places that feel a little luxurious, but I will trade luxury any day for CLEANLINESS!!! With a toddler, I want a clean place more than anything else...the Parkway met the requirements. We had a 3rd floor unit (2 bed/bath) and the 3 grandparents shared a 1st floor unit (2 bed/bath). I called ahead to ask for one unit to be on the first floor for the grandparents (no elevators at this resort) and even said I preferred at least one 1st floor unit over the units being in close proximity to each other. The front desk was wonderful and not only gave us one 1st floor unit, but made sure they were in the same building. Nice. This is not a luxurious resort, so if you are insistent upon modern furnishings, decor, and the very best quality of everything (as many timeshare owners are), then you should not stay here. It is NOT the Ritz, but it is very comfortable and very clean. If you just want a spacious, comfortable place to come home to in the evenings from the parks, then this is your place. The kitchen and bathrooms were spotless and well kept. LOVED the very clean jacuzzi tub after walking 10 hr. days. As in another review, the master bath shower on the 3rd floor is fairly small, but again, IT IS CLEAN. They do only provide clean towels in the middle of the week, but I've learned to just take a small bottle of laundry detergent (they did actually provide some detergent) and throw them in the wash myself when we need a new supply. Again, if you need to be pampered the towel thing might annoy you, but washing a load of towels once during the week was not a problem for us. They provide a stacked washer/dryer unit that worked fine and quickly. Also, I read some complaints about paying for maid service...we were only there one week!! I don't need someone to pick up after me every minute and I actually prefer no one enter my unit during the week, so yes we emptied our own trash and ran the dishwasher ourselves. The ONLY issue with anything being unclean at all, was the tile floor in the living room on the 3rd floor. It was swept and free from debris, but it could have used a wet mop and a nice floor rug just to "warm" up the atmosphere a bit:) The living room in the 1st floor unit was carpeted and felt a bit cozier. We stayed over the July 4th weekend and the resort was not crowded. In fact, we found it to be fairly quiet and private the whole time we were there. We finally realized we had neighbors when we saw their pool towels on the rail, but never heard nor saw anyone :) Parking was never a problem and many spaces were available right in front of our unit. We used the pool on two occasions in the late evening hours and it was clean. Our screened in porch over looked the pool and even when it was the busiest, it never seemed overcrowded. Buildings C and D are a perfect location for using the pool. We had a back door to our units (C building) that went out to the pool, shuffleboard area, grills, picnic areas, childrens playground, and poolside bar/restaurant. Our location was perfect. The playground is a very nice ammenity for small kids. Well kept, looks new and safe. We used the small arcade for a few minutes also. Probably wouldn't occupy teens very long and the games seemed old. We had a huge flat screen in the living room with a DVD player so just bring your own game system. We did call in an order to the pool side restaurant one evening and just went down to pick it up and bring back to our room. Food was good and resonably priced. Not open very late though during the weekdays, so plan accordingly. Plenty of restaurants in the area and we never minded driving so it wasn't a problem for us. I knew about a small waterpark at the Parkway's sister resort from all my research so I asked about it (no one mentioned it at all during check-in) at the front desk and was given directions (about 8 miles away, very easy and quick drive) and a pass to get in for a $5 fee. The pass was good for one day. We loved the waterpark! It was small and so were the slides, but perfect for school age kids. Also had a toddler play area. Again, teens would probably be bored by it pretty quickly, but youngers kids seemed to love it. Location: We went to the Disney complex (parks and downtown disney)everyday and often more than once during the day. VERY close. Maybe a ten minute drive into the main gates and never encountered any traffic even after the fireworks at Epcot on the 4th. The parking pass into disney is $12/day but it's good for the whole day AND at ANY of the 4 parks during the same day so if you park hop, you just pay the $12 once a day. Aside from staying on the Disney resort, you can't pick a better location. I would recommend this resort for a family with young kids anyday and we will stay here again! Just a few cons to be very picky (and for management to read)...water pressure in master unit shower was like being beat to death. I actually dreaded getting in because it was so hard, and I felt like I was draining a small river somewhere. In the days of going "green" it was definitely wasteful. Not enough (nearly none) towel bars/hooks to hang wet towels. They could easily add these on doors, etc. Master bath vanity on the 3rd floor unit was so narrow, I could only leave my toothpaste on the counter. No room for anything else on the countertop, so I had to use the second bathroom vanity top for make-up, hair supplies, etc. However, the 1st floor unit had a large vanity to in the master bath, so it just depends on your unit. 3rd floor units have more square footage (about 500 more!) and very high ceilings, but the 1st floor unit was still very comfortable for my parents and mother-in-law. 3rd floor unit had a "wet-bar" in the living area, but not 1st floor unit. 3rd floor unit had wardrobes in master suite, no closet or night stand, but a large closet just outside door in the living area. Not a problem, just be prepared. 1st floor unit had a closet in master suite and night stands...again, just depends on unit. My only REAL complaint is the $30 fee to use their WiFi (or $8 for 24 hrs.). Really ridiculous...it's 2009...even my dentist's office offers free WiFi!!! I hope they change this policy before we return. :)

Reviews.Title: “Not What Promised”
Reviews.Author: TWold
Reviews.Content: When arriving at the resort, was very disappointed. Resort was no where near a 5-star resort. Basketball court was a hoop in the driveway where cars would have to be moved to play. There was no housekeeping, unless you wanted to pay extra, clean towels where exchanged on Wednesdays only, but if you complain you can get them when you want. Pool is very small and not clean. There are no activities offered such as a regular resort would offer. Coffee maker did not work and when asked for a new one, was told I would have to wait until 8:00 am when staff arrived meaning I would have to wait 2 hours for my morning coffee. Exhaust fans in bathrooms did not work. Grounds were not kept clean. The only good thing, it was close to the parks. Would not recommend this resort to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home and more!”
Reviews.Author: DrCrazyA
Reviews.Content: The Parkway hotel offers huge rooms with all the amenities of home - washer, dryer, detergent, paper towels, full kitchen and utensils. It's great for large groups/families because the bedrooms are huge PLUS the living room can sleep quite a few as well. Very quaintly decorated. Immaculately clean. The theme parks are within a 10-15 minute drive from the hotel, so as long as you rent a car it's totally worth staying here at a fraction of the cost of staying at the theme parks. Not much in terms of food or even coffee there, but there are decent chain restaurants on the same block, or you can pick up groceries and cook/reheat leftovers since there's a full kitchen. The grounds are generally very quiet and peaceful. This is definitely where I'd stay if I returned to Disneyworld again.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed Expectations”
Reviews.Author: QueensMarine
Reviews.Content: This place exceeded my expections from all the reviews I read. The accomadation had two bedrooms, two baths a living room, kitchen with everything you need, a full sized fridge, microwave, toaster, dishwasher, full sized oven and much more. We had three TV's and a small area behind the kitchen with a washer and dryer. It was very clean and tasteful. Their is a Publix supermarket next door which you will need your car to got to. You can walk to a smaller supermarket/grocery type store. This store is was about a 1 minute walk from the hotel that does not require you to cross any streets or use any public sidewalks to get to. The pool area was great and not as small as some reviewers have said. The whirpo0l was also very nice. The pool area also has a bar that serves drinks and food. The pool area also has activities for the kids during the day for a nominal fee such as crafts. The hotel also has bingo games and black jack somenights. One night included musical entertainment by the pool area and a fish fry which cost $8 for adults and $6 for kids. The resort also has gas BBQ's that you can use although no one used them during my stay. Tennis courts and shuffleboard are also available. This place has no room service unless you request it for a fee. The master bedroom had a whirlpool tub in the bathroom. My only complaint was that to use the WiFi service you have to pay a $30 fee for one week or $8 for 24 hours. This really should be free during this day and age. This is a time share location. Initially when I checked in they asked me if I wanted a free breakfast and free tickets to which I said no and I was not asked again about the subject. The next morning I received about two phone calls and a knock on the door. I ignored this, learning from previous posts that these were the time share peolpe, and was never bothered again. If you stay call ahead and ask for a room that faces the Pool if you don't want to walk far or if you want to watch you kids. Each room has a small screened in porch. Mine faced the pool area and was very nice to have breakfast in the morning. If you have trouble with a lot of steps also ask to be on a bottom floor. I was on the third floor and this was a little difficult for my father in law who has had a hip replacement. The hotel is right next to the I-4 and the all the Theme parks are from 5 to 15 minute away. Their are countless eating areas from simple fast food to steakhouses in the immediate area. I can't wait to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Place!”
Reviews.Author: joancrounse
Reviews.Content: Wanted to add another positive review. Rented here because of the photos and TripAdvisor reviews and was not disappointed. Lovely spacious rooms, spotlessly clean. Staff went over and above to be helpful. The balcony was a great place for breakfast, especially coming from the cold northeast. Plenty of room to have the family stretch out, we never felt crowded. Very centrally located to the parks and not a bad drive to the east coast. I couldn't imagine going anywhere else on our next trip to FL.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Location and Great Space”
Reviews.Author: silverliningIreland
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Parkway. we are a family of 2 adults and 4 children aged 6, 7, and 15 year old twins. We all enjoyed staying at the Parkway. The Accommodation was spacious and we did not feel 'on top' of one another in the least. The Kitchen was so well equipped, it was like a home from home expericene. Only dirty washing I had to bring home was the Pj's as had washed and dried (with the appliances) as I went along. The pool area was lovely and not at all packed. There is a games room, a playground, a shuffle board area and also gas bar-b-q's which can be used at your convenience. The Radisson Hotel was across the street and was nice for my husband and I to go over a couple of nights for a quiet drink. The location was within easy walking distance of old town and an abundance of restaurants and shops. The disney parks were all only a 10 min drive away - perfect! I would definitely go back to the parkway and look forward to our next visit. Also a visit to Downtown disney is a must and especially go see Cirque du Soleil - you will be mesmerised!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ricmiclab1
Reviews.Content: We found Parkway International to be an excellent value for the package price that we paid to stay for a week. This is our 6th trip to the Disney area and I found this resort to be the best value for the money that we have so far stayed. I'm assuming that all rooms in this resort are the same with two bedrooms, a living room, a kitchen (with fully stocked utensils), a small laundry area w/ washer & dryer and two bathrooms (one adjoining the master bedroom and the other just across from the 2nd bedroom). The kitchen saved us a bit of money with a Publix Supemarket just down the street. We were just minutes from the Disney property and felt like we really received our money's worth at this resort. Be aware that there is no daily maid service provided for a week's stay. We did have one little "glitch" whereby there was sand in one of the beds when we first checked in but a maid was quickly sent over to change out the sheets. We didn't hold this against the resort as they were more than accomodating in charging us one less night's stay when our flight was cancelled due to weather conditions and I gave them less than 24 hours notice. One other thing. This is a timeshare resort but we were never approached or pressured. The only contact we had with a salesperson was after we checked in at the front desk they send you across the hallway to get your parking pass. I was delayed for a minute here as I was offered a free breakfast where I could hear about a timeshare offer and receive free tickets, etc. I just said I would think about it but never committed or attended. We have stayed at a different resort on each of our Disney trips but I would definitely consider this one again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: collettebristol_U_K_
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parkway for ten days.The suite was a very good size,and had everything you could need-dishwaher,washing machine,dryer etc.A nice touch was the bag of tissues,paper towel,washing and dishwasher powder put ready for you,along with coffee,sugar and creamers.Good idea for guests that dont want to stop off on their way to the hotel after a long journey,Swimming pool area was really nice,with a poolside bar.Children seemed to enjoy the games room. The only thing that let this resort down was the rooms were soooo dark.We had the lights on constantly.Apart from that though,we really couldnt fault it. Would I stay again? Most probably,yes.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay pity about the cutlery!!!”
Reviews.Author: DouglasCarlisle_UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two weeks on an exchange timeshare the room was spacious, clean & had a very good kitchen area. Checking in was easy the staff were great & the rooms were ready. There appears to be no maid service as such if you wanted towels & a change of bedding you had to ask for extra. Good pool area with childrens playground & great hot tub after long days at the theme parks. Our main & only gripe was that after about a week when the rooms change over the kitchen utensils were removed so we came back on the night to find spoons missing & other kitchen equipment missing very strange. When we informed the front desk they just issued us with new ones they said they would inform housekeeping no real explaination. A few days later we would discover glasses & chopping board missing so we had to ask for more although we were never charged for any of the missing items. Other than this the complex was superb clean & tidy & only five minutes from disneys hollywood studios no more than twenty from all Disney complex on the US192. Access to all areas are easy from this resort, there is a Wal-mart nearby & Old Town two minutes down the road. Its was a great stay & a super complex but they need to get the housekeeping sorted out but apart from that it was quiet pleasent stay.

Reviews.Title: “great room for the money”
Reviews.Author: zoom8942
Reviews.Content: we just stayed 5 nights at this hotel after getting a great rate off hotels.com. rooms were huge and offered anything you could want in a room. this was our first time staying off disney and was afraid it would loose the disney feel, but it didnt. the rooms were decorated in safari theme, we had a 3rd floor room and loved the high ceilings but hated the walk(no elevators) the washer and dryer came in handy as my little one was sick a couple days and needed washing done. the dislikes- ( im being nit picky)the floors were a little dirty, socks were brown, ring around jacuzzi tub(cleaned it myself and still used it and it was awesome) $7 a day for crib so brought my own pack n play the likes- nice heated pool, kids loved the playground,tennis court, game room,nature trail. lots of room, beds were comfy screaned in porch

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: our3boys
Reviews.Content: Even though check-in is 4:00, we were hoping to get in early after reading some reviews and couldn't.(driving 17 hrs and pouring rain with 3 children) But after we got in, it was well worth the wait. The staff was great. (Lobby closed at 10:00, don't know what you would do to check in after that) The water pressure in the shower and jetted tub was TERRIFIC! (towel bars in each bath) Plenty of storage, under wetbar, and in tv cabinet, each bedroom had a dresser and nightstands, closets in each room and hall. They also had a can opener, hand mixer, blender, 2 patty sized-george foreman, icemaker in freezer, among others people have mentioned. Cleaning service is available for more money, which I would rather bring some clorox wipes and spray to do myself and you know how clean it really is (as I do anywhere I go) The only reason I gave it a 4 on cleanliness is because when you walk in it looks very clean but as I was wiping down, there was some ketchup splattered on the dishwasher and the shelf in back above the jetted tub needed cleaned, etc. Lots of lights and many lamps that could be adjusted by the 3-way switch. The 2nd bedroom was not as well lit. Had ironing board & iron. The decor was very nice. Landscaping beautiful all the way around. Usually only a few people swimming at most with others at tables or lounging. We loved the 2 nature trails, and the ducks eat out of your hand (snakes basking in some branches obove water) Lots of nature to discover. We absolutely loved it. It is definitely better than a hotel and reviews were better than anywhere I looked including the more upscale places.

Reviews.Title: “Large clean villa in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: tenaflymom
Reviews.Content: This was a bit different than other hotels we've stayed in in and out of the Orlando area. Lower in star rating but it was an excellent value for what it was. The stretch of Irlo Bronson is like chain restaurant central with Shoney's, Golden Corral etc. Our favorite was Logan's Roadhouse down the street next to the Publix. Pretty good ribeye steak w/ grilled vegetable skewer and incredible hot butter rolls. You can pick up some breakfast and lunch supplies at Publix while you're there.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up to Parkway International”
Reviews.Author: darigg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our first stay at this resort. The jungle theme throughout the resort was nice with lots of trees and nature trails. You didn't even know you were near two major highways (I-4 and 192) The room we had on the third floor was beautiful. High ceilings, tiling and wallpapering were nicely done. The screened in porch overlooking one of the treed areas made breakfast on the balcony very relaxing. Both Ida and Carmen were very helpful during our stay. We were coming from another resort the week previous and we had to be out of that resort by 10AM. Normally checkin at the Parkway is 4PM, but Ida was helpful in allowing us to book in early so that we could put our perishables in the fridge right away without spoilage occurring. There were a few little issues at the resort that could have been improved on, but they were minor and we would not hesitate to book here again. For example, the pool bar wasn't open every day, you had to pay for internet use at Guest Services, the water pressure could have been better in the shower and the mattress was rock hard. The amount of trees around the pool shaded the pool over quickly, but I'm sure at another time of year this is not a problem as the sun gets higher in the sky. The timeshare salespeople could have been a little more discreet with their salesmanship. Considering that they were selling timeshare to a nearby resort, often they would walk through the pool area talking to their clients, sometimes quite loudly. They would even sit by the pool and we could hear the entire business discussion quite easily. Other than that, it is a beutiful resort with a great location near Disney World and I would recommend this resort to others.

Reviews.Title: “Two Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: Woolewoman
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked for another location, but they did not have the room type we requested, so we were upgraded to the Parkway International. At first I was a bit hesitant, it was very last minute - boy am I glad we took their offer. The suite was spacious, well laid out, and absolutely spotless. The kitchen was well equipped: toaster, blender, even a waffle maker. There is a Publix supermarket just down the road, making shopping easy. It was only 5 minutes to Disney, yet tucked back from 192, so quiet as could be. We got no Timeshare Pitch at all, just friendly, courteous service. I would return in a heartbeat (especially since it is 19 degrees outside as I write this).

Reviews.Title: “An absolute nightmare......Beware!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vacation807
Reviews.Content: This could have been a fabulous vacation, but thanks to the absolutely negligent mgmt. at this place, it wasn't. Though we had been enjoying our vacation, on our 5th day there we left our room at about 9am for the day, when we were apparently given a phone message on our room phone at 10AM that they would be letting movers in our room to change out the couches. So what happened next you ask? My husband's $500 work phone was STOLEN!!! (and no, it wasn't laying out in plain sight either). I found out later the "movers" had free reign over our room long enough to find something easy to tuck away, and that was that. The worst part? ABSOLUTELY NO CARE/CONCERN or follow-up was ever made to us. The Gen Mgr. at the time, Jackie (that's all the info the front desk was "allowed" to give us) is completely unprofessional. I've been so steamed about this incident I waited several months to write this review just to see if I'd get ANY follow-up. NOT! While this place was clean and the ammenities nice, it doesn't mean a thing when your property and safety are on the line. PLEASE BE CAREFUL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best place in town!!!!”
Reviews.Author: reviewstohelp
Reviews.Content: I am getting ready to book a hotel stay for January 4th, 2009 and I did not want to go back to this hotel because we stayed here in January of 2008 and wanted to try another place. However, I have read the reviews for my other options and lastly I read the reviews for Parkway and I'm coming back. During our stay in January 08 I had a wonderful experience. Nice room, clean, spacious, with a full kitchen, washer and dryer, nice pool(not terribly cold for January) and closest location to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “What a fab resort!”
Reviews.Author: MirandaC_UK
Reviews.Content: We booked through Greenbee.com which is run by Expedia for John Lewis. It was very cheap so I wasn't really expecting much & I was very pleasantly surprised. The apartment had two bedrooms, two bathrooms & a double sofa bed. The jungle theming was a bit OTT but the apartment was spotlessly clean & fully equipped, even pool towels were provided. We didn't really use the facilities at the resort as we were theme-parking every day & only discovered a programme of activities when we went to check out. The location is excellent - close to Disney, the I4 and right on the 192 with Celebration, Old Town, Wal-Mart & Golden Corral close by. We didn't appreciate the Timeshare pitch we had to endure to get a parking permit ''one hour of your time, free breakfast & reduced price themepark tickets'' - yeah right! Does anyone fall for that? ''it's not timeshare'' - yeah right! I'd definitely recommend Parkway International.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our family”
Reviews.Author: BIGRKH
Reviews.Content: My family loved this resort and it was perfect for us. We are a family of 5 (three 13 year olds) so space is very important to us and this condo style resort offers plenty of space. Each unit has an oversized master bedroom with a king bed and a very spacious master bathroom. The second bedroom has twin beds with a 2nd full bathroom right next to it. This proved to be very convenient during that mad rush to get ready every morning. The unit also has a full kitchen, a washer/dryer, dining area, and a good size living room with a sofa/bed. Everynight when we got home from the parks we had plenty of room to relax. The location was great, 5 minutes from Disney & 20 minutes from Universal. The condo was very clean. My wife is very critical when it comes to hotel cleanliness and the Parkway passed the test. The unit and the property was very clean and well maintained. The staff was was very accomidating....we arrived very early and they let us check in. Be aware of the Time Share proposal by the gentleman who gives you your parking pass. I said I wasn't interested and that was that. I got a great deal through expedia and will definately stay again. Please be aware this is a condo not a hotel, there is no maid service or fresh towels. We just threw the towels in the washer every morning on our way out the door to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: wrightwright
Reviews.Content: This is a nice condo style hotel. It is close to the parks. The kitchen has everything that is needed. The master bedroom has a jacuzzi tub. The units have a washer and dryer. We were on the 3rd floor and those units have vaulted ceilings. Internet is available for $30 per week. The second bedroom has twin beds. Discounted tickets are available at Guest Relations if you want to listen to them talk about their Vacation Club. It is easy access to I4 and the toll road to the airport. There is a Publix and Walgreens just down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Nice apartment at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: jweaver
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days here and had a great time. The apartment was massive for the four of us and it was very well equiped. Pool isn't big but it was never very full anyway. Location is good for Disney and ok for Universal / Sea World / Wet and Wild. A car is essential as there are no theme park transfers. Staff were always helpful. One word of advice: go to Publix for your shopping (less than a mile away), as the small shop near the resort can work out expensive even for small purchases.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC STAY!”
Reviews.Author: EVIEGrandRapids
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parkway through Interval exchange. I called ahead and spoke with Aida and requested room facing pool. We were assigned Conga 303 - FANTASTIC - thanks Aida :) The rooms were super clean (they've been remodeled recently completed) the area is super convenient - especially when going to airport - take Celebration Street and hop on 417 North - you're there! The Nature trail though small was very cool - Saw a Woodpecker - pretty big - pecking away. Also park rangers took away a Racoon - real big! - who was a "nuisance" to guest. I was lucky enough to take its picture - in the cage of course - All staff SUPER friendly. Even allowed for me to leave a gift for my uncle to pick up the next day (He lives in Orlando) Overall, yes not a "luxury" resort - but would not trade it for the luxury. The quiet - the rooms - all the best! Thanks to all the Staff at Parkway - When I go back to Orlando - will hold out to exchange here! By the way, my uncle who owns at Westgate was very impressed with the resort. Also we did visit Westgate for lunch with my uncle; and though the free lunch was nice; the noise; craziness; was not! I'll stay at Parkway without the free lunch

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient...but”
Reviews.Author: Dubya55
Reviews.Content: Parkway International Resort was conveniently located to attractions in Kissimmee and Orlando. We went for spring training games, and the Braves stadium is only a mile or so away. There is an excellent steak house within walking distance of the condo's (Charley's). The problems we encountered with the condos are minor, but worth mentioning anyway. There were two bedrooms and we were with another couple who took the master bedroom while we took the other one with twin beds. The twin beds were like sleeping on a torture rack. Hard as plywood. They really need to replace them. The business center was open, but their computers and printers were not working so they were not any help printing out boarding passes for our return flights. We stayed on the third floor and as far as I know there were no elevators to get there, so if you can't go up stairs you better ask for a first floor condo.

Reviews.Title: “Small resort, very close to Disney and highways”
Reviews.Author: Zaphod
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort as a base for taking in a bunch of MLB Spring Training games, as well as visits to the Universal theme parks. We stayed on a timeshare exchange belonging to one of my travelling companions. The resort's proximity to I-4 and route 417 (the Central Florida Greenway) makes it a great location for heading west toward the Tampa area and east toward the Space Coast. The south entrance to Disney World is less than a mile away, and the Wide World of Sports complex (Spring Training home of the Atlanta Braves) is only minutes away. The resort is fairly small and somewhat spartan. The pool is nice and has a bar/snack bar, but other than a tennis court and a shuffleboard court, there isn't much in the way of ammenities. The "nature trail" is a short boardwalk that leads to the Vacation Village Resort. The people at the front desk are very helpful and pleasant. I especially want to compliment Farena (please pardon my possible misspelling). We showed up around 10:00 just to scope out the place, and inquired about early check in. She said it was doubtful that anything was ready, but offered to start the paperwork for us and asked for our preference in buildings and floor. We asked for third floor with the balcony facing the woods where the natue trail is. She discovered that there were actually two units cleaned and ready to go in the building we wanted. We were in the unit within five minutes!! (Building H, third floor) The units are comfortable and well laid out. The main problem is that the second bedroom only has two twin beds which are not very comfortable for an adult. Also, while smoking is not allowed in the units, it is allowed on the balconies. The folks below us smoked out there pretty frequently, and the fumes drifted directly up into our balcony. We had to move inside and close the doors to keep the smoke out of our unit. Ugh! The kitchen contains a is fairly well stocked with dishes, utensiles, and pots & pans, however it does lack a dish drain for the items that you wash by hand. While this resort does not compare in overall quality to the Marriott Grande Vista or the Sheraton Vistana, it is perfectly adequate for a week-long stay. Unless they provide larger beds in the second bedroom and ban smoking on the balconies (like Marriott Grande Vista has just done), I probably wouldn't stay here again. If these features aren't a problem for you, I would recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place”
Reviews.Author: schomper42
Reviews.Content: I took my parents there and stayed in one of the 2 bedroom 2 bath units. It was fantastic. A great pool area. About 1100 square feet, jacuzzi tub, 3 televions, screened in porch, it was great. A very nice kitchen, an overall very nice layout and roomy. Very clean and we just loved it! I hope this helps someone.

Reviews.Title: “This Place was Perfect for Us”
Reviews.Author: nosnowbird
Reviews.Content: This place was absolutely perfect for us and exceeded all of our expectations. Our purpose for selecting this resort was based on a need to be close to the Florida Hospital - Celebration Health for 10 days. We desired to set up houskeeping instead of being holed up in a hotel for our time in the area. We searched the internet for lodging close to the hospital and sorted by the most reasonable price with the best reviews. The low nightly rate plus a few unpleasant reviews (mixed in with mostly positive reviews) had us a little concerned, but we booked anyway. Once we arrived, we were simply blown away by the accommodations. The rooms are very large and spotlessly clean. The grounds are mature with lots of plantings and large trees. We were really pleased with the discovery of boardwalk trails through the woods, some leading to a grocery story and restaurants, and some leading to neighboring resorts and some leading to even more trails. These walking trails became very important to us and we walked them every day. They are even lit up at night. The Parkway International Resort is only about 1/2 mile from the hospital. Another big benefit for us. The room as I mentioned was perfectly clean and well laid out. 3 TVs with a big screen in the living room. Two bedrooms, two bathrooms, full kitchen including dishwasher and washer & Dryer. There was even a bag of basic supplies on the kitchen counter waiting for us when we checked in. The room and grounds were quiet and we spent a lot of time on the screened in porch drinking our morning coffee and listening to the birds in the woods just outside. There were absolutely no bugs and we really wonder how anyone could write a negative review on this resort. On top of everything else, the staff was always very pleasant and helpful and flexible to our needs. Our stay there was wonderful and we hated to leave. Bottom line.....This place was just perfect for us and we will gladly stay there again and we will highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great well run clean resort”
Reviews.Author: jhillflorida
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at Parkway three years in a row and it is a very nice resort. When we last stayed in January of 2007 the resort was currently being renovated. We stayed in a suite that had not been renovated and it was still very nice. We are looking forward to staying there in January of 2008 and we understand all of the renovations have been completed. This is a very well run resort with an extremely nice pool and hot tub area. It is very close to everything. The rooms are very nice, very much like a place you could live at year round with a nicely equipped kitchen. The renovations will completely redo every unit including all new tile, carpet, appliances, etc. and the units will be fantastic when this is completed. We have never once had any major problems with the resort that they were not able to resolve. Our experience has been pleasant. When staying here you can walk to the other resorts that are part of Parkway and that means additional pools and hot tubs and other nice nature areas. We are not owners, we simply rent and I would recommend to anyone to consider this as a place to stay. We normally just relax and maybe attend one of two of the parks during our 3 - 4 week stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ugggh”
Reviews.Author: QueenMab85
Reviews.Content: I had an allergic reaction to mold in the room, firstly, and spent the entire week in itchy agony (because I didn't realize it was the room at first). Secondly, the grounds are unattractive and the decor tacky, not to mention the mold and dirty-looking fixtures. We took to calling the resort "the trailer park." The beds had sheets that should be printed on rather than slept on. The staff was helpful but very awkward - the aforementioned Kimber did not know when to stop telling us stories about her life when we had already told her we were very tired and wanted to get to bed. She was, however, very eager to help. The "resort" is very conveniently located - close to the Disney parks, the hospital (which I visited twice due to the allergic reaction), pharmacies like Walgreens, and restaurants. However, I would never, ever stay here again and would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: MsBeaton
Reviews.Content: We had read some other reviews posted on the website and had some concerns. However upon arriving we were more than pleasantly surprised. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. A fellow named Bill assisted us in making a reservation for us at the Luau at Seaworld and got us front row seats. A wonderful young lady named Kimber was fantastic. Helpful, freindly and courteous. Our room(#305 B) was excellent, brand new, spacious, very clean and efficient. Contained all the ammenities we needed,beds were comfortable,. Everything was new, fresh, and clean. We made use of Parkways pool area and tennis courts, and found the location to be perfect in relation to anything you needed to get to from 192 or interstate 4 including Disney, Seaworld, Mcdonalds, subway, KFC, shopping- target, wallmart, old town.
