We found the property itself to be very well maintained and clean, everything was lighted and decorated for christmas, it was a wonderful holiday experience at Parkway. Would definitely stay there again,

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place in Kissimmee”
Reviews.Author: thegreennan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great week in Parkway International. Superb location,nice grounds,nice pool. The 2 bedroom condo we had was well furnished, very clean and comfortable. Convenient for all the theme parks. I would certainly stay there again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location for Park-Hoppers”
Reviews.Author: WestHighlands
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1. Convenience to Entertainment & Dining - Very Centrally Located 2. Fastest property check-in I've ever had - No Hassle 3. QUIET... Once inside our unit (50 ft from the pool), didn't hear a thing the entire week. 4. Clean & Well equipped: Walked through the entire week in stocking feet & socks were never dirty (a common complaint in resorts like this). 5. Beds were comfortable with plenty of extra linens/blankets. 6. Units are very large. Visited Blue/Green Fountains same week as a friend was there & they were quite small by comparison. 7. Washer/Dryer combo in the unit was efficiency sized but it worked extremely well. Dried 4 pool towels in a matter of 30 minutes. 8. Non-Smoking in all units (ash trays provided on the patios if required) Cons: 1. Pool is a little dated and is not walk-in style. Deep (6.5') and clean and never crowded, just older - its not a brand-spankin' new property. However Pool Furniture was newer. 2. Amenities (i.e. food & bar) / Activities are fairly limited. It is a smaller property after all. 3. In-Room TVs not great (smallish & reception not great) 4. Master-Shower is quite small & the Master Vanity will not accomodate two adults. I was amazed at how quiet this resort was when we stayed during 4th of July week. Expected it to be crowded & noisy & it was just the opposite. Staff was courteous and helpful and check-out was as quick as the check-in. Part of the attraction for this resort in Orlando is that Liki-Tiki (within the same property management company) is available to use for $5. A short drive down US192, and this 220k gallon water attraction is great for the kids. We also used the bar/dining facilities there and they were excellent. Generous portions and prices, at least on the food, was very reasonable. Ladies, if you want a foo-foo drink (daquiri, etc.) expect to pay a premium. One catch is that they won't let you bring in a cooler of your own. I thought that this was cheesy at Liki-Tiki, but fair enough. The life-guards also didn't prevent kids under 42" from going down the big slide which is true at Orange Lake Country Club River Island, and so we saw many smaller kids having a blast, even though not closely monitored but there are usually lots of parents around anyway. Liki-Tiki is a very kid-friendly property and we're glad that we get to use it, I just don't want to stay there because it is at the far end of US192. Just remember that this is a Timeshare Resort NOT a hotel, even though they rent out nights for 3-day trips, etc. So don't expect hotel-like service or you'll be disappointed. This is a home-away-from-home style of vacation property. If you want room-service, etc. try Renaissance across from Sea-World. In summary, Parkway is a great location for a base of operations for a park-hopping stay in Orlando. We didn't spend a great deal of time at the resort, however it was a welcome place at the end of each day due to the comfort and size.

Reviews.Title: “On Family Vaction at Parkway Resort”
Reviews.Author: 2muchpeach
Reviews.Content: June 22 Me and my family stayed at the Parkway resort my family and I had lots of fun , great room , people was real nice and the kids love the pool . Now the family we had 2 rooms both on bottom level, Love the parking in the front of the building. The only thing I did 'n like was when the man told us they was given us a goodie package and it was just to take a survey of there other building and it really turn out to be a timeshare he lied and my family and I was'n there to listen to any timeshare it was a waste of our time and it took to long the kids was really ready to go to the parks . Now everything eles was nice. We really enjoy our stay there and would stay again only if we don't have to listen to a timeshare. It was clean and neat.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort but HARD BED!!!!”
Reviews.Author: websam
Reviews.Content: This was our honeymoon and we used our week on our Interval International timeshare. It was great all except the beds were very hard. My 1st night there I woke up the next day with my back hurting. Then we slept on the sofabed and it was way softer than the beds. The staff was fine and the pool, hot tub, kitchen, etc. was ok. However I would beware of the "free gift" they want to give you. The man at the guest services told us we'd get free breakfast plus another gift just to go look at their new building and "take a survey" telling them what we thought. It was a timeshare sell. Why would I buy a timeshare in FL when I own exchange? anyway, we wasted a whole lot of time doing that, and I was mad that they lied flat out to us. Otherwise, it was great. I won't stay there again due to the beds, I can't deal with hard beds.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: downeastmainiacs
Reviews.Content: We visited the Parkway International Resort 4/14/07 - 4/21/07 and booked by trading through Interval International. We stayed in building "B", which is the first building on the left when entering the resort. It is rated a "5 star" resort, but I have never stayed at a "5 star" resort that I would classify "5 star." I had read the reviews on this site prior to checking in and wasn't sure what to expect as the reviews range from great to terrible. Happily our stay was great. We arrived in the Orlando area earlier than the 4PM check-in time and called the resort to see if early check-in would be possible, and were told to "come right over." When we checked in, the staff person remembered speaking to me on the phone and was very friendly. Our unit was on the second floor and we had to climb one flight of stairs to reach it (these are three-story buildings with no elevators.) All week we were able to park right by the stairwell to our unit. The units are approximately 1200 sq ft, two bedrooms, one with a king bed and one with two twins, full kitchen with laundry, dining, living, two full baths with showers and tubs and a screened patio area. The units are non-smoking, which was great for our son who has asthma. The unit was very clean, though the decor was a little dated (this didn't bother my family...we don't go on vacation for the furniture) but was not badly worn. Everything in the unit was in fine order and we didn't have any trouble with anything all week. The beds were very firm but not unlike the beds you will find in most hotels. The sleep sofa would not have been comfortable to sleep on for a week, but then I've never seen one that was. We prepared several meals in the unit during the week, and saved substantially over eating out. We visited the pool most evenings after a day at the parks and never found it crowded. We didn't see any bugs all week. We were called a couple of times about the "free breakfast" (timeshare-speak for the sales pitch tour) but when I explained politely that we were not interested, the calls stopped. The only complaint I heard from my family all week was from my 17 year old daughter who missed wireless internet. (I did not miss it.) Honestly, we had a great week and our family of 4 had plenty of room to relax and spread out. I would not hesitate to book at this resort again or recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Resort is filthy”
Reviews.Author: rcmrph
Reviews.Content: We stayed as an Interval member exchanging as our home resort was not available. From the start, arriving at the unit the dishes were dirty from the previous people who stayed. I know, you do not get maid service at a time share resort but the unit should at least be clean when you arrive. As the stay wore on, on the third day, we discovered roaches in the bathroom. We thought after we killed one roach, that would be it as the resort did have a lot of trees. That was far from the end of it. When the staff was notified, they did not seem at all surprised and instead asked what size the roaches were, by the way they were large and small. The water pressure was bad during the whole stay with sketchy availability of hot water. The tubs also had very slow drains. The facility lacked chains on the doors (not kid friendly) and elevators. This is hardly a five star resort and much closer to a one star (being generous) resort.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Traveller7734
Reviews.Content: We did a timeshare exchange. Interval International has this as a 5 star resort. It is not in my experience (3.5 - 4 ). Staff were friendly and accomodating. Room was clean and kitchen well stock with tools, dishes etc. Furniture was in good shape and several rooms were being updated. Pool was fine, nothing special. Buildings are 3 floors, no elevator. Nature walk not a big deal Very convenient to Disney World and all the restaurans, stores, and shlock on route 192. Rte 192 easy entrance to Disney World, but you can not get out East bound onto 192 due to all the construction....need to come out onto 536 from the north, then back South down to 192.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: travelpicky
Reviews.Content: We arrived at midnight due to a late flight. We were shown to our room right away and wow what a great choice. The rooms were spacious and had all the comforts of home. It was very clean. The staff was great and very friendly. The pool was outstanding. I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else should we visit the Central coast of Florida again. We had two teens and they were very happy with the stay. Great for families. Best choice I ever made.
